<p>The 7 Series may not come standard with any driver assist safety features but it does include a system that will disconnect the alternator, fuel pump, and starter from the battery and will automatically open all doors and turn on hazard lights in the case of an accident. If the Active Protection system detects an imminent accident, the car will pretension the seat belts, close the windows and moonroof, and active post-crash braking. Most should opt for the Driving Assistance package that includes Active Driving Assistant Plus which includes active cruise control with stop and go ability, automatic forward braking, lane departure warning, frontal collision warning, city collision mitigation, and Pedestrian Protection. Traffic Jam Assistant and active lane keeping with side collision avoidance are also included.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/7-series/2017/2017-bmw-m760i-xdrive-first-drive-review/">First Drive review</a> of the 2017 BMW M760i xDrive, we loved the fast and effortless acceleration of the 2.5-ton sedan and the high amount of grip it provides through the curves. The interior was very impressive but not quite as good as the S65’s. The M760i is a great highway cruiser, providing plenty of luxury and stability.</p>

<p>“Although it’s loaded with technology and creature comforts, the materials aren’t quite as plush as the S-Class. And although it performed well in the 0–60-mph and quarter-mile tests, it lacked in terms of handling and athleticism. With tightened reflexes, the M760i starts to put some of the misgivings about the 7 Series’ performance to bed. But make no mistake: This is still a world-class luxury cruiser.”</p>

<p>At the end of our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/7-series/2016/2016-bmw-750i-xdrive-first-test/">BMW 750i xDrive First Test</a>, we said: “Many features in the BMW make it feel like a true experience, not just a vehicle. At the end of the day, though, that may not be enough of a reason to purchase the 750i over the S550.” We felt the 750i xDrive had vague steering and a good amount of body roll, and noted the S-Class provides a better ride.</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>BMW claims that the M760i is the quickest 7 Series ever, hitting 60 mph in a blistering 3.6 seconds.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p> </p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m5/2018/">2018 BMW M5</a> is new and now comes with all-wheel drive as standard. It also features more power, a more aggressive front fascia compared to the standard 5 Series, an adaptive suspension, and an active M differential.</p>

<p>The 2018 M5 is a high-performance luxury midsize sedan that slots above the compact M3 sedan.</p>

<p>Available as a single loaded trim, standard features include 19-inch alloy wheels, adaptive LED headlights, 20-way M multi-function front seats, leather upholstery, a 16-speaker Harman Kardon audio system, Bluetooth, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a>’s iDrive system with a 10.2-inch touchscreen, navigation, a head-up display, a 12.3-inch instrument cluster display, a rearview camera, keyless entry and start, a power-operated trunk, a heated steering wheel, front and rear parking sensors, and heated front seats.</p>

<p>The Executive package adds heated rear seats, active parking assist, ventilated and massaging functions for the front seats, a surround-view camera system, soft close doors, a wireless charging pad, and four-zone climate control. Standalone options include Apple CarPlay, a rear entertainment system, a moonroof, a Bowers &amp; Wilkins surround sound system, night vision, and carbon ceramic brakes.</p>

<p>The 2018 M5 is powered by a 4.4-liter twin-turbo V-8 with 600 hp and 553 lb-ft of torque paired to an eight-speed automatic transmission. EPA fuel economy ratings are 15/21 mpg city/highway.</p>

<p>The NHTSA and IIHS haven’t crash tested the 2018 M5. However, the 2018 5 Series sedan the M5 is based on received a Good score in all crashworthiness tests as well as in the headlights test in IIHS testing (Good is the highest possible score). In the IIHS’ front collision prevention test, the 2018 5 Series received a Superior rating after it avoided a 12-mph and a 25-mph collision (Superior is the highest score for the front crash prevention test). With its high scores, the 2018 5 Series received the 2018 Top Safety Pick+ award from the IIHS.</p>

<p>The Driving Assistance Plus package adds the Active Driving Assistant Plus, which bundles together blind-spot monitoring, lane departure warning, forward collision warning, pedestrian detection, automatic emergency braking, lane keeping assist with side collision avoidance, adaptive cruise control, rear cross-traffic alert, and traffic jam assist.</p>

<p>The 2018 M5 has 18.7 cubic feet of trunk space that can be expanded via the standard 40/20/40 split-folding rear seats.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m5/2018/2018-bmw-m5-first-drive-review/">2018 First Drive review</a>, we said the new M5 offers blistering acceleration and has regained its agile driving dynamics despite its massive footprint. The 2018 M5 features crisp turn ins and feels right at home on a race track. However, its size does hinder your ability to place it on the narrow roads. Ride comfort does suffer even in its softest setting and can get punishing in more aggressive settings. On the track, the 2018 M5 is right at home and can easily take on corners at high speeds with plenty of traction, allowing you to confidently go faster even with the electronic aids turned off.</p>

<p>The 2018 M5’s all-wheel-drive system is one of only a handful of systems that lets you put the car in full rear-wheel drive mode so that you can do smoky burnouts and drift to your heart’s desire.</p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>Minor updates for the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/4-series/2018/">2018 BMW 4 Series</a> include stiffer suspension for greater handling, new front and rear bumper valence, wheel offerings, and two new exterior colors: Sunset Orange and Snapper Rocks Blue.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>The 4 Series is offered as a coupe, convertible, and coupe-like four-door. With the coupe body style discontinued from the 6 Series lineup, the 4 Series coupe is the largest offered coupe by <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a>. As for the convertible, the 4 Series drop-top sits above the 2 Series convertible but below the larger 6 Series convertible. BMW extends is Gran Coupe body style to the 4 Series lineup, too, joining the bigger and costlier 6 Series Gran Coupe. A high-performance M4 model is offered on the coupe and convertible.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p><strong>Model: 430i, 430i xDrive<br/></strong>Engine and Transmission: turbocharged 2.0-liter I-4 – six-speed manual or eight-speed automatic<br>
Power: 248 hp/258 lb-ft<br>
EPA-Rated Fuel Economy: 24/34 mpg city/highway for the rear-drive coupe (or 21/33 with a manual transmission), 23/33 mpg for the all-wheel-drive coupe (automatic), 24/34 mpg for the rear-drive convertible (automatic), 22/32 mpg for the all-wheel-drive convertible (automatic), 24/34 mpg for the rear-drive Gran Coupe (or 23/34 with all-wheel drive).</br></br></p>

<p><strong>Model: 440i, 440i xDrive<br/></strong>Engine and Transmission: turbocharged 3.0-liter I-6 – six-speed manual or eight-speed automatic<br>
Power: 320 hp/330 lb-ft<br>
EPA-Rated Fuel Economy: 21/32 mpg city/highway for the rear-drive coupe (or 21/31 with all-wheel drive, and 19/29 mpg with all-wheel-drive and a manual transmission), 21/29 mpg for the rear-drive convertible (or 20/29 mpg with all-wheel drive), 21/32 mpg for the rear-drive Gran Coupe (or 21/31 mpg for the all-wheel-drive Gran Coupe.</br></br></p>

<p><strong>Model: M4<br/></strong>Engine and Transmission: turbocharged 3.0-liter I-6 – six-speed manual or seven-speed dual clutch automatic<br>
Power: 425 hp/406 lb-ft; 444 hp/406 lb-ft (Competition package); 493 hp/443 lb-ft (M4 GTS)<br>
EPA-Rated Fuel Economy (all RWD): 17/24 mpg city/highway for the coupe (or 17/25 mpg for the manual-transmission coupe), 16/22 mpg for the convertible (or 17/25 mpg for the manual-transmission convertible).</br></br></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/4-series/2018/">BMW 4 Series</a> comes standard with 18-inch double spoke light alloy wheels, LED headlights and fog lights, 10-way power front sport seats, SensaTec upholstery, Fineline Anthracite Wood trim with Pearl Gloss Chrome highlight, adaptive cruise control, iDrive system with 6.5-inch display screen, power moonroof, interior ambient lighting, and a three-spoke leather-wrapped sport steering wheel. Add more luxury with the Executive package that adds Icon adaptive Full LED headlights with automatic high beams, a surround-view camera system, a head-up display, speed limit information, and Parking Assistant. If you prefer exterior styling, opt for the M Sport Package that includes an aerodynamic kit, M Sport steering wheel, and 18-inch M Star-spoke wheels.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>Available driver assist safety features include blind spot warning and Active Driving Assistant that consists of Frontal Collision and Pedestrian Warning with City Collision Mitigation, and lane departure warning. Active Cruise Control with Stop &amp; Go keeps a pre-selected distance from the vehicle in front of you, great for stop-and-go traffic. The 4 Series comes standard with a safety feature that will automatically disconnect the alternator, fuel pump, and starter from the battery, turn on hazard lights and unlock all doors in the event of an accident.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/4-series/2014/2014-bmw-435i-convertible-first-test/">First Test review</a> of the 2014 BMW 435i convertible (before the car was refreshed with a revised engine), we said: “With all of those added bells and whistles, the 4 Series is a very nice, luxurious, and impressive car, but it never feels special. You can assign it a larger number, but at the end of the day, the 435i is still mostly a 3 Series. If you happen to like the 3 Series, and want one in convertible form, you’ll be very pleased with the 435i. If you just like having the wind in your face, you can probably think of a few other options you could buy with [our car’s $65,775 as-tested price].”</p>

<p>“The numbers show the M4 has it when it counts. But just driving the thing around? Feels like a plain old luxury car. Refined and nice enough but not the be-all, end-all of hot Germanic muscle machines,” we said in a comparison between the <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/camaro/2016/comparison-2015-bmw-m4-vs-2016-chevrolet-camaro-ss/">first place Chevrolet Camaro SS and the second place BMW M4</a>. “It’s time for BMW to either rethink or reclaim ye olde Ultimate Driving Machine. Times done changed.”</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>BMW’s TwinPower Turbo technology does not mean a twin-turbo set-up but instead means that it uses a single twin-scroll turbocharger.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x4/2018/">BMW X4</a> did not receive any significant changes for the 2018 model year.</p>

<p>The X4 is one of two coupe-like SUVs in <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a>’s lineup, positioned below the X6. In BMW’s SUV lineup, the X4 slots above the the new X2 and X3, but below the larger and more expensive X5 and X6.</p>

<p><strong><a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x4/2018/">2018 BMW X4</a> xDrive28i</strong>: the entry-level model comes standard with four driving modes (Eco Pro, Comfort, Sport, Sport+), all-wheel drive (xDrive), variable sport steering, 19-inch Y-spoke alloy wheels, LED fog lights, Xenon adaptive headlights with LED headlight-rings, satin aluminum exterior trims, eight-way power front seats, SensaTec upholstery, Fineline anthracite wood trim with pearl gloss chrome accent, iDrive infotainment system with a rotary controller, Bluetooth and HD radio. Also standard is automatic climate control, front and rear parking sensors, a power moonroof, and interior ambient lighting.</p>

<p><strong>2018 BMW X4 M40i</strong>: The M40i upgrades the engine to an M Performance turbocharged inline-6 unit, adds a Sport exhaust, Dynamic Damper control, 19-inch double-spoke light alloys wheels, Shadowline exterior trim, Ferric Gray mirror caps, an aerodynamic kit, 14-way power front Sport seats, Nevada leather upholstery, brushed aluminum exterior trim, and a 16-speaker Harman Kardon surround sound system.</p>

<p>For additional comfort, opt for the Cold Weather package that consists of heated front and rear seats, a heated steering wheel, and retractable headlight washers. The M Sport package, optional on the xDrive28i, includes 19-inch M double-spoke wheels, a selection of wood trim with gloss chrome highlights, an aerodynamic kit, Sport seats, Shadowline exterior trim, and an M steering wheel. The Parking Assistance package comes with a surround view camera system and a self-parking system and the Lighting package includes adaptive Full LED lights and automatic high beams.</p>

<p>The X4 xDrive28i is powered by a 2.0-liter turbocharged I-4 engine that produces 240 hp and 260 lb-ft of torque and is backed by an eight-speed automatic transmission. With standard all-wheel drive, the powertrain delivers an EPA-rated 20/28 mpg city/highway. The X4 M40i’s 355-hp, 343-lb-ft of torque 3.0-liter turbocharged inline-6 also comes paired with an eight-speed automatic and delivers 18/25 mpg. In <em>Motor Trend</em> testing, the X4 M40i hit 60 mph in 4.9 seconds (xDrive28i in 6.2 seconds) and stopped from 60 mph in 120 feet (xDrive28i in 123 feet).</p>

<p>The X4 does not come standard with any driver assist safety features but opt for the Driving Assistance package and receive the Active Driving Assistant system (lane departure warning, frontal collision warning, <strong>city</strong> emergency automatic braking, and pedestrian protection), a head-up display, blind-spot monitoring, and speed limit information. The Driving Assistance Plus package adds adaptive cruise control with stop and go functionality and <strong>extended</strong> automatic braking but the Driving Assistance package is required.</p>

<p>The BMW X4 xDrive28i offers 17.7 cubic feet of cargo space with the rear seats up and 49.4 cubic feet with the rear seats down, the exact same amount of cargo space as the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/mercedes-benz/">Mercedes-Benz</a> GLC300 4Matic Coupe. Front passengers in the X4 receive 40.4 inches of front seat legroom and 34.8 inches in the rear seats.</p>

<p>The X4 comes equipped with BMW’s iDrive system with Bluetooth, HD Radio, USB port, and a rotary controller. A navigation system, Apple CarPlay, SiriusXM satellite radio, and a Wi-Fi hotspot are optional. The standard sound system is a nine-speaker, 205-watt system but it can be upgraded to a 600-watt Harman Kardon surround sound system. A wireless charger and iPad holder are available. BMW’s ConnectedDrive customer portal is standard.</p>

<p>In 2018 Motor Trend <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/bmw-x4-2018-suv-of-the-year-contender/">SUV of the Year testing</a>, we enjoyed the X4’s quickness and cargo room (surprisingly) but not handling, ride, or steering feel. We didn’t care much for the interior’s low-quality leather and design. We concluded, “We know BMW can build a fun-to-drive, sporty SUV. Unfortunately the X4 misses the mark.”</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x4/2015/2015-bmw-x4-first-test/">First Test review</a> of the 2015 BMW X4 xDrive28i, we enjoyed the quick acceleration but not the ride quality.</p>

<p>“If you’ve gone through the mental gymnastics necessary to arrive at the X4,” we wrote, “you won’t be disappointed in what’s delivered. In the end, though, you’re paying significantly more money for a vehicle that’s slightly faster than the SUV it’s based on but slower than the cars it also shares parts with, not to mention the fact it’s less practical than either and less accommodating to passengers. But, what the heart wants, the heart wants.”</p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 X5 receives an updated eight-speed automatic transmission on non-plug-in models. Also, the X5 35i and 35d models receive standard trapezoidal tailpipes. New optional equipment now includes 21-inch M wheels.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>In size, the X5 is currently <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a>’s largest SUV above the X1 and X3, as well as the more coupe-like X4 and X6. In price, the X5 is more expensive than other BMW SUVs except the X6. BMW is preparing a larger SUV with a bigger interior, for those who need a more comfortable third row.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p>The X5 sDrive35i (RWD) and X5 xDrive35i (AWD) come equipped with the standard 3.0-liter turbocharged I-6 that produces 300 hp and 300 lb-ft of torque and delivers 18/25 mpg city/highway for the sDrive and 18/24 for the xDrive. Opting for the X5 xDrive35d will increase fuel economy to 23/29 mpg thanks to the 255-hp, 413-lb-ft 3.0 turbodiesel I-6. The xDrive50i packs a 4.4-liter twin-turbo V-8 that produces 445 hp and 480 lb-ft of torque and has an EPA-rating of 15/24 mpg. The X5 xDrive40e plug-in hybrid is powered by a 2.0-liter turbocharged I-4 paired to an electric motor that produces a total output of 308 hp and 332-lb-ft. The X5 xDrive40e can drive up to 14 miles on all-electric power and has a combined fuel economy rating of 24 mpg, close to the diesel’s 25 mpg combined. The range-topping and high-performance X5 M also utilizes a 4.4-liter twin-turbo V-8 but tuned to produce an impressive 567 hp and 553 lb-ft of torque and delivers 14/19 mpg.</p>

<p>Standard features for the X5 include 19-inch V-spoke wheels, adaptive HID headlights with the Corona headlight rings, LED fog lights, 14-way power and heated front seats, Poplar wood trim, Black SensaTec upholstery, dynamic cruise control, a 10.2-inch display screen with BMW navigation, The iDrive system with touchpad controller, panoramic moonroof, front and rear parking sensors, and interior ambient lighting.  The contents of the Executive package increase luxury with soft-close automatic doors, head-up display, wireless charging and WiFi Hotspot, rear manual side window shades, and ceramic controls. If you want upgraded leather in your X5, make sure to get the Ivory White Interior Design package (or the Mocha Design Interior package) that includes Ivory White Nappa leather upholstery, Black Nappa leather dashboard, and contrast stitching on the seats and dashboard.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>The X5 earned a five-star overall rating from the NHTSA (five stars is the highest possible rating). The IIHS issued the highest rating of Good for the X5’s moderate overlap front and side crash tests, but the remaining three crash tests have not been conducted.</p>

<p>For the front crash prevention evaluation, the X5 received two ratings. The SUV earned the rating of Advanced for reducing a 12-mph impact by 9 mph and reducing a 25-mph impact by 7 mph thanks to the optional Frontal Collision Warning with City Collision Mitigation. However, the highest rating of Superior was issued to the X5 equipped with the optional Frontal Collision Warning with Extended Collision Mitigation for completely avoiding both 12- and 25-mph frontal collisions. City Collision Mitigation is included in the Active Driving Assistant system that is part of the Driving Assistance Plus Package. Extended City Collision Mitigation is part of the ACC Stop and Go + Active Driving Assistant system that can be added to the Driving Assistance Plus package that also consists of blind spot warning, a surround-view camera system, and a speed-limit indicator.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In the <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x5/2014/2014-bmw-x5-first-test/">First Test</a> review of the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x5/2014/">2014 BMW X5</a>, we said that “the refreshed X5 is a nice update on the old truck. It’s a little quicker and it’s got more features and a better interior. On the whole, though, it still feels like it’s stuck in a midlife crisis. Does it want to be a two-row midsizer, or three-row full-size? Or does it want to be a sport wagon with a lift kit? We’re not really sure, and it doesn’t seem like BMW is, either.”</p>

<p>When we tested the 2016 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x5/2018/">BMW X5</a> xDrive40e plug-in hybrid in our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x5-plug-in/2016/2016-bmw-x5-xdrive40e-plug-in-hybrid-first-test/">First Test</a> review, we didn’t like how the charging power tops out at 3.5 kilowatts, meaning owners can’t benefit from the 6.6 kW Level 2 public chargers. The plug-in can run up to 14 miles on all-electric power, not very impressive thanks to the 5,200-pound curb weight, but about even with the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/volvo/xc90/2018/">Volvo XC90</a> T8 (14-mile range), <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/mercedes-benz/">Mercedes-Benz</a> GLE550e (12 miles), and the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/porsche/cayenne/2018/">Porsche Cayenne</a> S e-hybrid (14 miles). What the electrified powertrain did provide is quick acceleration, with a <em>Motor-Trend</em>-tested 0-60 mph time of 6.2 seconds. The X5’s gasoline engine kicks on smoothly when need and the SUV provides a comfortable ride. We said, “The X5 xDrive40e plug-in hybrid shows that anyone (with a lot of money) can get their hands on a spacious and tall four-cylinder BMW matched with 315mm-wide rear tires and sports car-like weight distribution, and it can drive more than 10 miles without using any gas.”</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>In <em>Motor Trend’s</em> Real MPG testing, the plug-in X5 was rated at 18.5/26.3 (21.3 combined) mpg combined driving, lower than the EPA’s rating of 23/25 mpg (24 mpg combined).</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p>With the exception of a reorganized package and options structure, the X1 did not receive any significant changes for the 2018 model year.</p>

<p>The X1 is <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a>’s smallest and most affordable crossover, positioned below the new X2, X3, X4, X5, and X6.</p>

<p><strong>2018 X1 sDrive28i/xDrive28i</strong> <strong>xLine Design</strong>: The base xLine Design trims includes black high-gloss trim with pearl chrome accent, black SensaTec leather, 18-inch Y-spoke wheels, three driving modes (Eco Pro, Comfort, and Sport), satin aluminum roof rails, matte chrome exterior trim, eight-way power front seats, leather-wrapped steering wheel, automatic climate control, power liftgate, a 6.5-inch center screen with iDrive and a controller, Bluetooth, and HD radio.</p>

<p><strong>2018 X1 sDrive28i/xDrive28i</strong> <strong>M Sport Design</strong>: The M Sport Design comes equipped with high-gloss roof rails, a sport automatic transmission, an aerodynamic kit, M steering wheel, Sport seats, 18-inch M double-spoke wheels, Shadowline exterior trim, and aluminum hexagon interior trim with Estoril Blue matt highlight.</p>

<p>Available on the xLine Design, the Luxury package comes with a choice of different Oyster Dakota leather color combinations and a choice of different fine-wood Oak grain trim with a pearl chrome accent. Both trims are also available with sliding and reclining rear seats, wireless charging, a Wi-Fi hotspot, Apple CarPlay, a Harman Kardon surround sound system, Sport seats (xLine Design), and M Sport suspension (M Sport Design).</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x1/2018/">2018 BMW X1</a> is powered by a 228-hp, 258-lb-ft of torque 2.0-liter turbocharged I-4 backed by an eight-speed automatic and delivers an EPA-rated 23/32 mpg city/highway with front-wheel drive (sDrive) and 22/31 mpg with all-wheel drive (xDrive). In <em>Motor Trend</em> testing, the 2016 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x1/2018/">BMW X1</a> xDrive28i hit 60 mph in a quick 6.8 seconds and stopped from 60 mph in 122 feet.</p>

<p>In IIHS testing, the 2018 X1 received the highest rating of Good in all five crash tests and the second-highest rating of Advanced for front crash prevention for reducing the speed of a 12-mph collision by 10 mph and reducing the speed of a 25-mph collision by 7 mph thanks to the optional <strong>city</strong> emergency automatic braking system found in the Driving Assistance package. The <strong>extended</strong> emergency automatic braking system that comes with the optional adaptive cruise control system with stop &amp; go was not tested. The X1 is not considered a Top Safety Pick because the crossover received the second-lowest score of Marginal for the headlights evaluation. The Driving Assistance package comes with Active Driving Assistant that consists of lane departure warning, frontal collision warning, pedestrian protection, city emergency automatic braking and automatic high beams. The adaptive cruise control system with <strong>extended</strong> emergency braking is also available in that package for an additional cost.</p>

<p>The X1 crossover offers 27.1 cubic feet of cargo space with the rear seats up and 58.7 cubic feet with the seats down. Front passengers receive 40.4 inches of legroom and rear passengers get 37.0 inches.</p>

<p>The X1’s iDrive infotainment system is displayed on a 6.5-inch center screen with a rotary controller and comes with Bluetooth, HD radio, ConnectedDrive customer portal, and a USB port. A 205-watt audio system is standard along with remote engine start. A navigation system with a touchpad controller, SiriusXM satellite radio, Apple CarPlay, a wireless charger, and a head-up display are optional. Also optional is a 12-speaker Harman Kardon premium surround sound system, a Wi-Fi hotspot, and Remote Services. With Remote Services, you can use a smartphone app to control various functions of your vehicle like remote start with climate control, lock/unlock the doors, locate your vehicle, flash the lights, and access vehicle information and status.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x1/2017/2017-bmw-x1-xdrive28i-first-test-review/">First Test</a> of the 2017 BMW X1, the interior received mixed reviews—some found that many components felt and looked cheap while others liked the cabin. Same goes for the driving dynamics: certain editors enjoyed the nimble handling but others felt it was subpar with not enough grip and dull steering. However, most editors liked the powertrain that provides quick acceleration as well as fast and smooth shifts.  Most editors also commended the X1’s off-road performance. We concluded by saying, “It’s not as terrible as some editors made it out to be or as good as others defended it as. For an entry-level luxury crossover designed and marketed to customers who have no idea which wheels are driven or why it matters, the X1 is perfectly adequate.”</p>

<p>During Motor Trend’s <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/bmw-x1-2017-suv-of-the-year-contender/">SUV of the Year testing</a>, we liked the powertrain, interior room, and off-road performance. However, the narrow and unsupportive front seats, certain cheap interior components, and an unsure chassis keep the X1 from earning finalist status. “In all, we found the X1 confusing and unsure of itself. Is it a proper BMW? A Mini by way of Savile Row? Is it a nice little luxury crossover or badge engineering gone awry? One thing we could agree on: There was no consensus to advance it to the finals.”</p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x2/2018/">BMW X2</a> compact crossover is new from the German automaker, adding another model to their lengthy lineup of premium crossovers. The X2 shares the same platform as the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x1/2018/">BMW X1</a> but is shorter and lower.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>In <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a>’s crossover lineup, the X2 is positioned above the X1 in price but below the larger X3, X4, X5, and X6. The X2 is the sportier and bolder version of the X1, but the new crossover lacks the extreme fastback styling of the bigger coupe-like X4 and X6 models.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p>The new <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x2/2018/2018-bmw-x2-first-look-review/">2018 BMW X2</a> will initially be offered in a single model called the X2 xDrive28i powered by a 2.0-liter turbocharged I-4 that produces 228 hp and 258 lb-ft of torque and is backed by an eight-speed automatic that routes power to an xDrive all-wheel-drive system. BMW claims the X2 can hit 60 mph in 6.3 seconds, and we look forward to testing one soon.</p>

<p>Standard features for the 2018 X2 xDrive28i include the Driving Dynamics Control drive modes (Comfort, Eco Pro, and Sport), full LED headlights and taillights, 18-inch Y-spoke wheels (19-inch are available), SensaTec upholstery, adjustable interior ambient lighting, the sixth-generation of the iDrive infotainment system, a rear spoiler, and a 6.5-inch freestanding center display. Available features include Dynamic Damper Control (0.4 inches lower ride height), a panoramic moonroof, Dakota leather upholstery, and an 8.8-inch touchscreen display with navigation, a full-color head-up display, a Wi-Fi hotspot and Apple CarPlay compatibility. The X2 M Sport X package adds 19-inch M double-spoke wheels (20-inch are available), a sport-tuned transmission with paddle shifters, and exterior trim finishers with accent strips. An M rear spoiler and M Sport suspension are available with the M Sport X package.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>Driver assist safety features can be found in the Driving Assistance package that includes lane departure warning, speed limit information, automatic high beams, frontal collision warning, pedestrian warning, and the City Braking feature (automatic emergency braking). Additional driver assist safety features include adaptive cruise control and Active Driving Assistant that work together to keep the vehicle at a safe and predetermined distance to the vehicle ahead at speeds between 19 and 87 mph. A self-parking feature dubbed Parking Assistant (to help with parallel parking) and parking sensors are also optional. Although the IIHS has yet to test an X2, the BMW X1 — the crossover on which the X2 is based — is considered a 2017 Top Safety Pick.</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>Although the X2 has the same wheelbase as the X1, the X2 is 3.2 inches shorter and rides 2.8 inches lower, resulting in a more aggressive and sportier stance and improved driving dynamics.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p>In addition to adding an updated iDrive multimedia system and standard LED headlights, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m4/2018/">2018 BMW M4</a> gets a new CS variant with more power as well as a specially tuned active M differential and adaptive suspension.</p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m4/2018/">BMW M4</a> is a compact rear-drive high performance coupe or convertible that slots above the M2 and below the M6.</p>

<p>Regardless of the body style, the 2018 M4 comes standard with LED headlights, 18-inch alloy wheels, adaptive suspension, an active M differential, 10-way power front M Sport seats, a 16-speaker Harman Kardon audio system, Bluetooth, a rearview camera, keyless entry and start, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a>’s iDrive interface with an 8.8-inch screen, cloth/leather upholstery and navigation.</p>

<p>Options include 19-inch alloy wheels, full leather upholstery, front and rear parking sensors, automatic parking assist, side and top view camera, a head-up display, carbon ceramic brakes, a heated steering wheel, Apple CarPlay, a wireless charging pad and a moonroof.</p>

<p>The 2018 M4 is powered by a 3.0-liter twin-turbo I-6 rated at 425 hp and 406 lb-ft of torque and can be paired to a six-speed manual or seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. Opting for the Competition package increases total output to 444 hp. The most powerful version is the M4 CS, which is rated at 454 hp and 442 lb-ft.</p>

<p>EPA fuel economy ratings for the M4 coupe are 17/25 mpg city/highway with the manual and 17/24 mpg with the automatic. The M4 convertible is rated at 17/25 mpg with the manual and 16/22 mpg with the automatic.</p>

<p>Blind-spot monitoring is a standalone option as is the Active Driving Assistant, which bundles together forward collision warning, pedestrian detection, automatic emergency braking, and lane departure warning.</p>

<p>The 2018 M4 coupe can hold 15.8 cubic feet of stuff, and that space can be expanded via the split-folding rear seats. Convertible models have 13.1 cubic feet of trunk space with the roof up and 7.8 cubic feet with the roof down.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m4/2015/2015-bmw-m3-m4-first-test/">2015 First Drive</a>, we said that the M4 drives identically to its M3 sedan sibling, offering excellent driving dynamics especially on the track. The ride, however, is stiff regardless of the suspension mode. Although the M4 has precise steering that’s weighted well, not much is communicated from the front tires.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/lexus/rc-f/2015/2015-bmw-m4-vs-2015-lexus-rc-f-comparison/">2014 comparison test</a> against the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/lexus/rc/2018/">Lexus RC</a> F, the BMW M4 won because it was more engaging to drive. The M4’s engine gave it an edge over the RC F because of its torque-rich power band. Its lighter weight and minimal body roll also meant that the M4 was easier to drive fast. However, the M4’s higher performance threshold means it takes more time to get comfortable with its limits.</p>

<p>As with most BMW M vehicles, the M4 coupe features a carbon fiber roof to make it lighter; however, it gets deleted if you opt for the sunroof.</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m3/2018/">2018 BMW M3</a> gets standard LED headlights and an updated iDrive multimedia system. A new CS variant with a m0re aggressive suspension setup and more power has been added, but only 550 units will be available for the U.S. market. The coupe version of the M3 is called the M4.</p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m3/2018/">BMW M3</a> comes in a single trim with a decent number of standard features that include an adaptive suspension, the active M differential, 18-inch alloy wheels, 14-way heated M sports seats up front, a 16-speaker Harman Kardon audio system, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a>’s iDrive system with an 8.8-inch screen, navigation, a rearview camera, and keyless entry and start.</p>

<p>Options include a head-up display, side and top view camera, a heated steering wheel, automatic parking assist, front and rear parking sensors, 19-inch alloy wheels, a moonroof, Apple CarPlay, and a wireless charging pad. The M3 CS gets go fast extras like a specially-tuned adaptive suspension and active M differential, and cosmetic changes like a carbon fiber-reinforced plastic front splitter and rear diffuser.</p>

<p>The 2018 BMW M3 is powered by a 3.0-liter twin-turbo I-6 rated at 425 hp and 406 lb-ft of torque. With the Competition package, output increases to 444 hp. A six-speed manual is standard and a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic is optional. The M3 CS is the most powerful M3 available with 453 hp and 443 lb-ft. EPA fuel economy ratings ate 17/25 mpg city/highway with the manual and 17/24 mpg with the automatic.</p>

<p>The 2018 M3 hasn’t been crash tested by the NHTSA and IIHS. However, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/3-series/2018/">2018 BMW 3 Series</a>, the car on which the M3 is based, received a five-star overall rating from the NHTSA (out of a possible five stars). In IIHS testing, the 2018 3 Series received a Good score in crashworthiness tests except for the passenger side front small overlap impact where it hasn’t been tested yet and the headlights test where it received an Average score (Good is the possible highest score).</p>

<p>In the front crash prevention test, the 3 Series received an Advanced rating after it reduced the severity of a 12-mph and 25-mph impact by 7 mph and 6 mph respectively (Superior is the highest rating for the front crash prevention test) As a result, the 2018 3 Series received the Top Safety Pick rating from the IIHS.</p>

<p>Active drive assistance features are available as part of different optional package or as standalone extras. Blind-spot monitoring is available as a standalone option while automatic high beams are part of the Executive package. The Driving Assistance package adds speed limit info, and the Active Driving Assistance, which bundles together forward collision warning, pedestrian detection, automatic emergency braking and lane departure warning.</p>

<p>The 2018 M3 has a 17-cubic-foot trunk that can be expanded via the standard split-folding rear seats.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m4/2015/2015-bmw-m3-m4-first-test/">2015 First Drive</a>, we were impressed with the M3’s on-track performance, offering excellent handling, flat cornering with nearly no body roll and plenty of power from its 3.0-liter twin-turbo. However, even with the adaptive suspension in its softest setting, the ride is firm on public roads, and there’s not enough feedback from the steering wheel.</p>

<p>In our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m3/2015/2015-bmw-m3-long-term-verdict/">Long-Term Verdict review of a 2015 model</a>, we concluded that the M3 is a fun sports sedan that works well as a daily driver thanks to its large trunk and spacious seating. Despite the squeaky carbon ceramic brakes, the M3 offered strong track performance when they got to the right temperature; however, for those who won’t take the car to the track, we’d recommend sticking with the standard pads.</p>

<p>In addition to the M3’s carbon fiber roof, the 2018 M3 CS has a carbon fiber hood to reduce the car’s overall weight and lower its center of gravity.</p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The M550i xDrive and the electrified 530e iPerformance join the 5 Series lineup for the 2018 model year. Full Merino leather and an Anthracite Alcantara headliner are now available and a leather dashboard is now a stand-alone option. <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a> also revised and added some equipment packages to the lineup.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>The 5 Series sedan slots right in the middle of BMW’s sedan lineup, above the 3 Series but below the flagship 7 Series. In price, the 5 Series is positioned above the 4 Series lineup but below the more expensive 6 Series Gran Coupe and convertible.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p>The entry-level <strong>530i</strong> and 530i xDrive (AWD) come powered by a 248-hp, 258-lb-ft of torque 2.0-liter turbocharged I-4 engine that delivers an EPA-rated 24/34 mpg city/highway and 23/33 mpg respectively. The <strong>530e</strong> and 530e xDrive plug-in models are rated at 29 mpg combined and 28 mpg combined and can drive up to 16 miles and 15 miles on all-electric power respectively. Both plug-in models are equipped with a 180-hp, 255-lb-ft of torque 2.0-liter turbocharged I-4 paired to an electric motor that produces a combined power output of 248 hp and 310 lb-ft. A 335-hp, 332-lb-ft 3.0-liter turbocharged I-6 powers the <strong>540i</strong> (20/30 mpg) and 540i xDrive (20/29 mpg). The <strong>M550i</strong> xDrive model packs a 4.4-liter twin-turbo V-8 that churns out a potent 456 hp and 480 lb-ft of torque and delivers 16/25 mpg. All engines are backed by an eight-speed automatic, and an <strong>M5</strong> model is on the way.</p>

<p>Standard features for the 2018 5 Series include 18-inch double spoke light alloy wheels, adaptive LED headlights and LED fog lights, 16-way power adjustable driver’s seat, an 8.8-inch digital cluster, a 205-watt 12-speaker audio system, iDrive 6.0, BMW navigation with a 10.2-inch touchscreen, and interior ambient lighting with 11 colors to choose from. For driving enthusiasts, the available Dynamic Handling Package on the M550i includes Integral Active Steering, an adaptive system that increases steering speed at low speeds and decreases it at high speeds in addition to rear-wheel steering. The package also consists of the Active Roll Stabilization system and the Adaptive M Suspension plus that delivers a great combination of comfort and handling.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/5-series/2018/">BMW 5 Series</a> received a five-star rating from the NHTSA for the sedan’s overall score (out of a possible five stars) and the IIHS’ top honor of a 2017 Top Safety Pick+ for scoring the highest rating of Good in all five crash tests (small overlap front, moderate overlap front, side, roof strength, and head restraints and seats) and the highest rating of Superior for front crash prevention. The 5 Series was able to avoid 12- and 25-mph forward collisions thanks to the available Frontal Collision Warning with City Collision Mitigation found in the Driving Assistance Plus package. The package also includes the self-parking system, Parking Assistant Plus, a surround view camera system with 3D view, blind spot warning, daytime pedestrian protection, lane departure warning, and rear cross-traffic alert.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/5-series/2018/2018-bmw-530e-edrive-plug-in-hybrid-first-drive-review/">First Drive review</a> of the new 2018 530e plug-in, we enjoyed all the green-coaching displays, improved efficiency over the last 5 Series hybrid, the sedan’s decent handling on twisty roads, good levels of grip on wet roads, and steering effort, although there was little to no feel. The best part about the sedan was the extra price for the plug-in over the regular 530i — just $200. We said, “So, what is it? A darned good bargain if A) you can resist its zillion packages and options, B) you feel guilty rattling around in that 4,500-square-foot house just the two of you, and you’re determined to make carbon amends, and C) you aren’t expecting the Ultimate Driving 5 Series.”</p>

<p>After reviewing the <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/5-series/2017/2017-bmw-540i-m-sport-first-drive-closing-door/">2017 BMW 540i M Sport</a>, we said: “Bestowed with interior perfumes, the highly functional iDrive 6.0, gesture control, and a generous overhaul with quality cabin materials, the substantially more fanciful G30 cabin will be a major contributor to positive acclaim.” The driver assist features and semi-autonomous system were impressive, the driving dynamics were spot-on, and acceleration was stout.</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>The sedan’s available Display Key uses the Remote Control Parking feature to maneuver the 5 Series into or out of a parking space while standing outside the vehicle.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 M6 is only available in two body styles: the convertible and the coupe-like sedan called the Gran Coupe. <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a> has discontinued the M6 Coupe.</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m6/2018/">2018 BMW M6</a> is a high-performance, rear-drive convertible or sedan that slots above the smaller M3 and M4. It’s available as a single loaded trim.</p>

<p>Standard features include 20-inch alloy wheels, an Active M differential, a performance-tuned suspension and drive model selector, full LED headlights, heated 20-way power adjustable front multi-contour seats. a 16-speaker Harman Kardon audio system, Bluetooth, BMW’s iDrive interface with a 10.2-inch screen, navigation, a rearview camera, keyless entry and start, parking sensors, ambient lighting, a wireless phone charging pad, and leather upholstery.</p>

<p>Options include Individual two-tone leather upholstery, a heated steering wheel, ventilated front seats, a 16-speaker Bang &amp; Olufsen audio system, heated rear seats (Gran Coupe only), active front seats, power rear and side sunshades, a surround-view camera system, Apple CarPlay, carbon ceramic brakes, and night vision.</p>

<p>The 2018 M6 comes with a 4.4-liter twin-turbo V-8 with 560 hp and 500 lb-ft of torque. A six-speed manual or a seven-speed twin-clutch automatic transmission are the two gearboxes available. Output increases to 600 hp when equipped with the Competition package. EPA fuel economy ratings regardless of body style are 14/20 mpg city/highway with the manual or 15/22 mpg with the automatic.</p>

<p>Adaptive cruise control and automatic high beams are standard on all models. Additional active driver assistance features are available via the Driving Assistance package, which adds blind-spot monitoring, speed limit info, and the Active Driving Assistant, which bundles together lane keeping assist, forward collision warning, pedestrian detection, and automatic emergency braking.</p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m6/2018/">BMW M6</a> Convertible has 10.6 cubic feet of cargo space with the roof down and 12.4 cubic feet with the roof up. For more cargo capacity, the M6 Gran Coupe has 16.2 cubic feet with the split-folding rear seats in place and 44.7 cubic feet with them folded.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m6/2013/2012-bmw-m6-convertible-first-test/">2013 First Test</a>, we said that the M5 offers strong straight-line performance and, for such a large car its stopping ability is impressively short. Despite its size, the M6 handles in a neutral manner but is also capable of big smoky power slides thanks to its potent turbocharged engine. The interior is well-appointed and the convertible’s soft top can be raised and stowed at speeds of up to 25 mph.</p>

<p>The BMW M6 is currently the only M vehicle available as a four-door coupe-like sedan called the Gran Coupe.</p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x3/2018/">BMW X3</a> has been redesigned for 2018 and the lineup now features an M Performance model, the X3 M40i. The available head-up display is 75 percent larger and the standard 10.25-inch touchscreen is available with Gesture Control technology. Active Protection pre-crash accident detection system is standard along with sport seats and three-zone automatic climate control. Aerodynamics were improved with <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a> Active Kidney Grille, underbody cladding, a roof spoiler with aero blades, and Air Curtains.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>The X3 slots in the middle of BMW’s SUV lineup above the entry-level X1 but below the larger X5. The X3 is also positioned before the X4 and X6 SUV coupes. If you’d consider a wagon or hatchback, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/3-series/2018/">BMW 3 Series</a> is offered as a wagon and spacious four-door hatchback.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p>At first, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/x3/2018/">2018 BMW X3</a> will be offered in two models, but expect more to join the lineup later. The standard X3 xDrive30i is powered by a 2.0-liter turbocharged I-4 that produces 248 hp and 258 lb-ft of torque. The quicker and more expensive X3 M40i utilizes a 3.0-liter turbocharged I-6 that cranks out 355 hp and 369 lb-ft of torque. An eight-speed automatic backs both engines and all-wheel drive is standard.</p>

<p>The 2018 BMW X3 will come standard with the new iDrive 6.0 system with the iDrive Controller and 10.25-inch touchscreen.  BMW Gesture Control, which involves making gestures with your hand to control various features (such as adjusting volume or skipping to the next track) is optional. The ParkNow service helps owners find parking spaces and pay for them as well. Additionally, the On-Street Parking Information service also assists in finding parking by using historical and current data to draw conclusions on parking availability. Additional features include a WiFi-hotspot offering LTE connection for up to 10 devices and Apple CarPlay can be used wirelessly. The Luxury package consists of two-tone front and rear bumper trim finishers, SensaTec upholstered dashboard, and a chrome kidney grille. The M Sport Package includes the M Aerodynamic kit, Shadowline exterior trim, 19-inch M wheels, M Sport steering wheel, and M door sills.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>Two driving assist packages are available on the new 2018 X3. The regular Driving Assistance package includes Active Blind Spot Protection, lane departure warning, Daytime Pedestrian Protection, Frontal Collision Warning with City Collision Mitigation, rear cross-traffic alert, and speed limit information. The Driving Assistant Plus package offers the Active Cruise Control with Stop &amp; Go, Active Lane Keep Assistant with Side Collision Avoidance, Traffic Jam Assistant, Evasion Aid and front and rear cross traffic alert.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In <em>Motor Trend’s</em> <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/lexus/nx200t/2015/the-big-test-2015-luxury-compact-crossovers/">2015 Big Test of luxury crossovers</a>, the BMW X3 xDrive28i (a last-generation model) came in second out of five contenders. We didn’t like some interior materials, the average ride quality, and felt there wasn’t enough outside sound reduction. When accounting for the entire car lineup, the 3 Series slots above the 2 Series but below the 4 Series lineup in price. The 4 Series comprise the coupe, convertible, and coupe-like four-door variants of the 3 Series models.</p>

<p>The base 2018 BMW 320i comes standard with SensaTec upholstery, 17-inch light alloy V-spoke wheels, dynamic cruise control, ambient lighting, LED fog lights, Servotronic adaptive steering, and BMW Connected Drive services. If you want additional luxury, opt for the Premium package that includes heated front seats, navigation, head-up display, real-time traffic information, and remote services; or purchase the Executive package and your 3 Series will come with adaptive full LED lights, automatic high beams, a surround view camera system, Parking Assistant (self-parking feature), a digital instrument cluster, and Dakota leather.</p>

<p>The high-performance M3 comes standard with M Drive modes, 18-inch M Ferric Grey V-spoke wheels, adaptive M suspension, heated front seats, carbon fiber interior trim with black chrome highlights, automatic headlights, LED headlights, navigation, Harman Kardon surround audio system, and an Anthracite headliner. For additional speed and handling prowess, order the Competition package and get an additional 19 hp (for a total of 444 hp), more direct steering ratio, adaptive M suspension, and improved Active M Differential and dual-clutch transmission (if equipped) settings. The package also includes 20-inch forged Light Alloy wheels, high-gloss black trim, and a Sport exhaust with black-chrome dual tailpipes. The M3 is available in coupe and convertible body styles in the form of M4 models.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/3-series/2018/">2018 BMW 3 Series</a> received the highest five-star rating from the NHTSA for the sedan’s overall safety rating. The 3 Series is considered a 2017 Top Safety Pick+ from the IIHS (the organization’s highest honor) for getting the highest score of Good in all crash evaluations and the score of Advanced for front crash prevention with the available Frontal Collision with City Collision Mitigation. The 3 Series was able to reduce the speed of a 12 mph collision by 7 mph and the speed of a 25 mph collision by 6 mph. That safety feature is part of the Driving Assistance package that includes speed limit information and the Active Driving Assistant that consists of lane departure warning, pedestrian warning, and the previously mentioned forward collision warning with City Collision Mitigation. Blind spot warning, front and rear parking sensors, and adaptive cruise control are standalone options.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In an <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/alfa-romeo/giulia/2017/alfa-romeo-giulia-bmw-330i-audi-a4-mercedes-benz-c300-cadillac-ats-jaguar-xe-lexus-is-200t-volvo-s60-comparison/">eight-way premium car Big Test comparison</a>, the 2017 BMW 330i came in second to last place due to lack of fun driving dynamics, dated interior with average quality, and the fact that it was not a leader in any category. However, we did like the ride comfort and zingy engine. “How the mighty have fallen. The reigning winner and standard-bearer of the class suffers from old age, dulled dynamics, and a lack of personality.”</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/jaguar/xe/2017/bmw-335i-m-sport-vs-jaguar-xe-s-comparison/">Head-2-Head comparison</a> between the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/jaguar/xe/2017/">2017 Jaguar XE</a> S and the 2015 BMW 335i M Sport (an upgraded and revised version became the 340i), the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/jaguar/">Jaguar</a> came out the victor due to its sexier design, strong power, impressive suspension set-up, light-footed feeling, and the overall fun, sporty, and scalpel-like driving dynamics. “I appreciate the BMW’s solid, confident, and accommodating persona that has kept it at the top with customers and journalists for decades. But to me, sportiness is key. The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/jaguar/xe/2018/">Jaguar XE</a> S is every bit as good as the BMW 335i while being more fun to drive. All I can add is, ‘Amen’.”</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>BMW’s straight-six engine is a rarity in today’s market. The single-turbo unit used in the M3 produces 406 lb-ft of torque from just 1,850 rpm all the way to 5,500 rpm, where the engine hits its max power output of 425 hp.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m2/2018/">2018 BMW M2</a> gets standard LED headlights, replacing the HID units.</p>

<p>The 2018 M2 coupe comes in a single trim with standard features including 19-inch alloy wheels, LED headlights,  14-way power adjustable front sports seats, leather upholstery, a Harman Kardon audio system, Bluetooth, the iDrive interface with an 8.8-inch screen, navigation, a rearview camera, keyless entry and start, and a rear spoiler.</p>

<p>Options include Apple CarPlay, a moonroof, and the Executive package, which adds adaptive headlights, a wireless charger, rear parking sensor, and a heated steering wheel.</p>

<p>The 2018 M2 is powered by a 3.0-liter turbo I-6 with 365 hp and 343 lb-ft of torque paired to a standard six-speed manual or an optional seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. EPA fuel economy ratings are 18/26 mpg city/highway for the manual and 20/26 mpg with the automatic.</p>

<p>The 2018 M2 hasn’t been rated by the NHTSA and IIHS. The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/2-series/2018/">2018 BMW 2 Series</a>, the car on which the M2 is based, received a Good score on all crashworthiness tests except for the passenger side front overlap test where it hasn’t been tested yet and the headlights test where it received an Acceptable rating (Good is the highest possible score). On the IIHS’ front crash prevention test, the 2018 2 Series received an Advanced rating after it reduced the severity of a 12-mph impact by 10 mph and a 25-mph impact by 7 mph (Superior is the highest rating on the front crash prevention test). As a result, the 2018 2 Series received the 2018 Top Safety Pick rating from the IIHS.</p>

<p>The 2018 M2 has a 13.8-cubic-foot trunk that can be expanded via the standard split-folding rear seats.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/2016-bmw-m2-first-test-review/">2016 First Test</a>, we were impressed with the M2’s performance, which nearly matches the larger, more powerful M4 in acceleration and grip. Despite being on the heavier side, the M2 is fun to drive with excellent steering feel, a playful chassis, and surprisingly precise manual transmission. The stiff suspension does mean ride quality suffers and there’s no adaptive suspension option that lets you soften it.</p>

<p>The new 2018 i3s model features a sport chassis, wider track, and more power. For the 2018 model year, the i3 also receives an exterior refresh, the latest iDrive 6 interface, and standard full LED headlights. There is also a new cloth-leather trim combination called Giga Brown with natural leather and Carum Spice Grey cloth and two new exterior colors: Melbourne Red Metallic and Imperial Blue Metallic.</p>

<p>The i3 hatchback is one of two <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a> i EVs along with the much more expensive and quick i8.</p>

<p><strong>2018 i3</strong>: The i3 comes standard with 19-inch i Turbine light alloy wheels, LED headlights, power-folding and heated side view mirrors, black mirror caps, Kenaf interior dash and door panels, the Deka World interior, manual adjustable front seats, and a 6.5-inch center display with the latest iDrive system, BMW Navigation Business, Bluetooth, SiriusXM satellite radio, HD radio, and a USB port. Also standard is automatic climate control, rear parking sensors, heated front seats, and fast-charging capability.</p>

<p><strong>2018 i3s</strong>: The i3s sports trim adds a more powerful electric motor, sport suspension, 20-inch i double spoke bicolor light alloy wheels, flared wheel arches, and a black A-pillar and roof trim.</p>

<p>Interior environment options include the standard Deka World, but for an additional cost, Mega, Giga, and Tera World interiors are available. Each one has its own unique color combination, seat fabric, and renewable material sources. The only available package is the Technology + Driving Assistant package that consists of BMW Navigation with ConnectedDrive Services, real-time traffic information, and adaptive cruise control with Active Driving Assistant. Options include a moonroof, Apple CarPlay, and a blue seatbelt strap (i3s only).</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/i3/2018/">2018 BMW i3</a>’s powertrain consists of a 33 kWh battery pack that powers a 170-hp, 184-lb-ft of torque rear-mounted electric motor that routes power to the rear wheels through a one-speed automatic. The i3s packs the same electric motor but with more power output, 184 hp and 199 lb-ft of torque. Without the range extender engine, the 2017 i3 has an EPA-rated driving range of 114 miles on a full charge and 118 mpge combined driving. The optional range extender engine is a small 0.6-liter two-cylinder engine that produces 38 hp and 41 lb-ft of torque and supplements the battery pack once all electricity is drained (has no mechanical connection to the rear wheels). When equipped, the full-electric range drops to 97 miles and 111 mpge but the total driving range increases to 180 miles. Using a Level 2 charger will take about 4.5 hours to charge a depleted battery. Once 2018-model-year fuel economy numbers are released for the i3s, we will update this section. In <em>Motor Trend</em> testing, the i3 with the range extender hit 60 mph in 7.0 seconds and stopped from 60 mph in 125 feet.</p>

<p>In IIHS testing, the i3 received the highest rating of Good in four crash tests and the second-highest rating of Acceptable for the head restraints and seats evaluation. Front crash prevention was given the second-highest rating of Advanced because the hatchback reduced a 12 mph collision by 9 mph and reduced a 25 mph collision by 7 mph thanks to the optional emergency automatic braking feature found in the Technology + Driving Assistant package. Besides the previously mentioned technology features, the package also includes adaptive cruise control with stop and go functionality and Active Driving Assistant that consists of emergency automatic braking, frontal collision warning, pedestrian detection, and speed limit information. The standard BMW Assist eCall includes emergency request (SOS button) and enhanced automatic collision notification, and BMW Remote Services includes stolen vehicle recovery, remote door unlock and BMW Connected App compatibility. Front and rear parking sensors are optional.</p>

<p>Cargo space is not one of the i3’s fortes, as the small hatchback offers 15.1 cubic feet with the seats up and 36.9 cubic feet with the seats down. Front passengers receive 40.5 inches of legroom and rear passengers get a tight 31.9 inches. With the rear seats up, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/bolt-ev/2018/">Chevrolet Bolt EV</a> has a similar 16.9 cubic feet of cargo space, but with the seats down, that increases to 56.6 cubic feet. The Bolt EV has 41.6 inches of front legroom and 36.5 inches of rear legroom.</p>

<p>The i3 comes equipped with BMW Navigation Business and iDrive systems with a rotary controller and a 6.5-inch center display screen. The system also includes Bluetooth, SiriusXM satellite radio, HD radio, and a USB port. A 16-speaker Harman Kardon surround sound audio system, Apple CarPlay, and a self-parking system are optional. The optional upgraded BMW Navigation system with ConnectedDrive services takes in all relevant factors into account when routing the i3, including battery charge level, driving style, traffic, and elevation changes. The i3 is capable of DC fast charming (7.4 kW) and comes with an occasional use chagrin cable (1.2 kW).</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/i3/2017/2017-bmw-i3-range-extender-first-test-review/">First Test review</a> of the 2017 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/i3/2018/">BMW i3</a>, we felt that the renewable materials in the interior were “painfully hipster L.A.,” but the seats were comfortable, outward visibility was good, and the hatchback offered an SUV-like driving position. Like most EVs, the i3 is quick off the line and offers pretty quick acceleration, but because of the very narrow tires, the braking distance is a little long and handling dynamics are not fun. We look forward to finding out if that changes at all with the new 2018 i3s model.</p>

<p>Additionally, in our review of a 2017 model, we found that the narrow tires coupled with quick steering make highway travel uneasy and ride quality deteriorates. When the range extender engine turned on while on the highway, it was seamless, but when at a stop, it was obvious with vibration and a generator-like noise. “Although decidedly not the way forward, ” we concluded, “the BMW i3 still marks an important step in society’s transition from the internal combustion engine to electrification. Like the Ryan FR-1 Fireball, the U.S. Navy’s first jet airplane, which supplemented the jet turbine with an old-fashioned piston-powered propeller, the i3 REx will ultimately go down as a Wikipedia oddity that helped forward the march of progress. In the meantime, though, the 2017 i3, like the MiG-21, might be outgunned by the latest and greatest EVs, but that doesn’t mean there isn’t a place for it in an ever-expanding electrified market.”.</p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p><a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a> refreshes the 2 Series with new LED headlights and taillights, and an updated interior including new instrument panel stitching and a new instrument cluster. Standard equipment now includes LED fog lights, LED headlights, 17-inch bi-color wheels on the 230i, and 18-inch bi-color wheels on the M240i. iDrive 6.0 with touch screen technology on navigation equipped models is now available as are adaptive full LED headlights. Cognac is a new leather upholstery color and new exterior colors include Mediterranean Blue Metallic, Seaside Blue Metallic, and Sunset Orange Metallic.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>The 2 Series is the entry-level model for BMW U.S. lineup. The BMW slots below the 3 Series, 4 Series, 5 Series, 6 Series, and 7 Series. Other entry-level BMW models include the X1 and 320i, both vehicles with four doors unlike the 2 Series. Above the 2 Series, the 4 Series coupe and convertible models start at about $10,000 more.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p>The 2 Series base engine is a 2.0-liter turbo-four that generates 248 hp and 258 lb-ft of torque and comes equipped in 230i models. When backed by the eight-speed automatic, the <strong>230i</strong> convertible delivers 23/24 mpg city/highway (rear-wheel drive) and 23/33 mpg with all-wheel drive. The coupe is rated at 24/35 mpg (RWD), 24/33 mpg with AWD, and 21/32 mpg with the six-speed manual in RWD form (AWD is not available with the six-speed manual). The <strong>M240i</strong> packs a 335-hp, 369 lb-ft of torque 3.0-liter twin-turbo I-6 that delivers 21/32 mpg (RWD) and 21/31 (AWD) in the convertible body style and with the eight-speed automatic. The rear-drive six-speed manual gets 19/29 mpg. The M240i coupe is rated at 21/32 mpg in both RWD and AWD. The rear-drive six-speed manual gets 19/28 mpg. The high-performance <strong>M2</strong> coupe packs a 365-hp, 343 lb-ft of torque 3.0-liter I-6 backed by a seven-speed dual-clutch transmission (20/26 mpg) or a six-speed manual (18/26 mpg).</p>

<p>The Track Handling package, available on 230i models, adds variable sport steering, adaptive M suspension, M Sport brakes, and 18-inch gray wheels wrapped in Michelin Pilot Sport performance tires. If you opt for the M Sport package, your 2 Series will be equipped with a thick Nappa Leather M Sport steering wheel, an aerodynamic kit, shadowline trim, and a unique headliner. An available 12-speaker Harman Kardon Surround Sound audio system includes a 360-watt amplifier, five tweeters, five midrange speakers, and two central bass speakers located under the front seats.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>The IIHS gave the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/2-series/2017/">2017 BMW 2 Series</a> its highest honor of 2017 Top Safety Pick+ for scoring the highest score of Good for all crash evaluations (small overlap front, moderate overlap front, side, roof strength, and head restraints and seats) and for the second highest score of Advanced for front crash prevention. The 2 Series was able to reduce the speed of a 12 mph frontal collision by 10 mph and the speed of a 25 mph collision by 7 mph thanks to the optional Frontal Collision Warning with City Collision Mitigation driver assist safety feature found in the available Driving Assistance Plus package. That package also consists of lane departure warning and Pedestrian Protection, a feature that can detect pedestrians and automatically brakes if needed to avoid a collision. Speed Limit Info and automatic high beams are also included in the above package.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/2-series/2014/2014-bmw-228i-coupe-first-test/">First Test review</a> of the 2014 BMW 228i (the 228i has been replaced by the 230i), we enjoyed the premium sports coupe for its fun driving dynamics and usable but small size. We said, “The 2 Series is superior to the previous 1 Series in every way with its more streamlined looks, better performance and fuel economy, and more livable dimensions,” and, “The bottom line is that the 2 Series is a huge win for BMW enthusiasts everywhere, and even if it isn’t the reborn 2002 that BMW’s marketing campaign says it is, it still marks a return to form for the roundel brand.”</p>

<p>We had a blast driving the 2014 M235i during our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/2-series/2014/2014-bmw-m235i-first-test/">First Test review</a> because the car is reminiscent of the discontinued, fun-to-drive and compact 1 Series M (or 1M). About the car that has been replaced by the M240i, we said: “The M235i is one of the best-driving BMWs in recent memory, on par with the 1M and the last-generation M3 not only in performance standards, but also in how much it makes you smile.”</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>In <em>Motor Trend</em> testing, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m2/2017/">2017 BMW M2</a> equipped with the seven-speed dual-clutch automatic hit 60 mph in a quick 4.2 seconds. Read about our experience long-term-testing a <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/m2/2018/">BMW M2</a> <a href="//www.motortrend.com/car-reviews/long-term/filter/bmw/m2/">right here</a>.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The M Sport package now offers an exclusive carbon fiber trim that was previously available only on the M6. A new metallic Sonic Blue exterior color is now available, as are new bi-color 20-inch M wheels.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>Positioned above the 2 and 4 Series coupes and convertibles, the 6 Series only slots below the flagship 7 Series. The M6 (coupe, four-door gran coupe, and convertible) is the most expensive M model in the automaker’s performance lineup.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/6-series/2018/">2018 BMW 6 Series</a> comes with a choice of three different turbocharged engines paired to an eight-speed automatic with the exception of the M6’s six-speed manual transmission. <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a> labels its all-wheel drive system as “xDrive” and the Gran Coupe is a sedan styled to resemble a coupe. The 6 Series is made up of the 640i, 650i, and the M6 models. The B6 Alpina is an exclusive model; learn more about it <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/alpina-b6/2016/2017-bmw-m6-gran-coupe-2016-alpina-b6-comparison-review/">in this M6 vs. B6 Alpina comparison</a>.</p>

<p><strong>640i Engine and Power:</strong> Turbocharged 3.0-liter I-6, 315 hp/330 lb-ft of torque<br><strong>Transmission:</strong> Eight-speed automatic</br></p>

<p><strong>650i Engine and Power:</strong> Twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter V-8, 445 hp/480 lb-ft<br><strong>Transmission: </strong>Eight-speed automatic</br></p>

<p><strong>M6 Engine and Power:</strong> twin-turbocharged 4.4-liter V-8, 560 hp (575 hp with the Competition Package)/500 lb-ft<br><strong>Transmission: </strong>six-speed manual or seven-speed dual-clutch automatic</br></p>

<p>For models below the M6 is the M Sport Edition package that consists of the M steering wheel, 19-inch double-spoke wheels (20-inch available), aerodynamic kit, head-up display, Shadowline exterior trim, soft-close automatic doors, front ventilated seats, and ceramic controls. Additional performance options include carbon fiber mirror caps, black kidney grills, stainless steel pedals, and the Adaptive Drive system that significantly reduces body roll. A BMW iDrive 5.0 infotainment system,  10.2-inch screen with BMW navigation, 3-D maps, 200 GB hard drive, voice command, and over-the-air navigation map updates are standard. Available entertainment options include a Bang &amp; Olufsen sound system, Apple CarPlay, and BMW iPad holder for additional entertainment.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/6-series/2018/">BMW 6 Series</a> comes standard with the automaker’s Active Protection System that detects an imminent collision then automatically prepares the vehicle by pretensioning the seat belts, closing all windows, and activating post-crash braking. Also standard is an impact sensor that activates the Battery Safety Terminal that automatically disconnects the alternator, fuel pump and started from the battery, then turns on hazard light, interior lights, and unlocks doors. BMW Assist eCall, also standard, includes the Emergency Request (SOS button) and Enhanced Automatic Collision Notification while BMW Remote Services includes Stolen Vehicle Recovery, Remote Door Unlock, and My BMW Remote app. Also standard is adaptive cruise control, a rearview camera, Dynamic Stability Control with traction control, adaptive LED headlights, front, side, and curtain airbags, adaptive brake lights, and programmable LED daytime running lights.</p>

<p>The available Driving Assistance Plus package consists of Active Driving Assistant (Lane Departure Warning, Frontal Collision Warning, City Collision Mitigation, and Pedestrian Protection) that can automatically brake for you, adaptive cruise control with Stop &amp; Go driving, Active Blind Spot Detection, side and aerial view cameras, and speed limit information.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/6-series/2013/audi-s7-bmw-650i-gran-coupe-xdrive-mercedes-benz-cls550-4matic/">2013 European four-door coupe comparison</a>, the BMW 650i Gran Coupe xDrive topped the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/audi/s7/2018/">Audi S7</a> and <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/mercedes-benz/">Mercedes-Benz</a> CLS550 4Matic, and we said: “If this test were just about pure, back-road capability, the S7 would get the nod. But as the BMW is about 95 percent as capable as the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/audi/">Audi</a> (identical 0.94 max g, too), but offers so much more in desirability, craftsmanship, and that all-important X-factor, we’re calling it the winner.”</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/6-series/2013/2013-bmw-640i-gran-coupe-first-test/">2013 First Test review</a>, we enjoyed the driving dynamics and styling of the Gran Coupe but felt the car was too expensive and had tight rear seats, “Problem for the [Gran Coupe], though, is that the A7 and CLS are quicker, and the Panamera is more engaging and dynamically capable. Moreover, our well-equipped tester exited the checkout line at $99,645. Ouch.”</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>The available Night Vision with Pedestrian Detection uses a thermal imaging camera that recognizes people, animals, and objects based on the heat emitted. Pedestrian detection can indicate individual pedestrians on or near the road up to 330 feet.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The all-new <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/regal/2018/">2018 Buick Regal</a> gains a long list of new tech features and two new body styles.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/regal/2018/">Buick Regal</a> is a midsize car that’s available in front- or all-wheel-drive configurations. Two body styles are available including the <strong>TourX </strong>wagon and a sedan-like hatchback called the <strong>Sportback</strong>. There’s also a performance-oriented model called the Regal GS, which comes standard with all-wheel drive but is only available in the Sportback. All Regal TourX wagons come standard with all-wheel drive.</p>

<p><strong>Overview</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/">Buick</a> Regal is available with two engine choices including a 2.0-liter turbo-four with 250 hp and 260 lb-ft of torque on front-drive models, or 295 lb-ft on all-wheel drive variants. This engine comes paired to a nine-speed automatic transmission in front-drive guise or an eight-speed unit in all-wheel-drive cars. A 3.6-liter V-6 with 310 hp and 282 lb-ft is exclusive to the Regal GS and comes only with the nine-speed automatic.</p>

<p>EPA fuel economy ratings are 22/32 mpg city/highway for the front-drive Regal Sportback and 21/29 mpg for the all-wheel-drive variant and the Regal TourX wagon. Go for the all-wheel-drive Regal GS and the fuel economy ratings are 19/27 mpg.</p>

<p>Both variants offer excellent cargo space at 31.5 cubic feet with the split-folding rear seats up and 60.7 cubic feet with them down. Should you need more space, the Regal TourX wagon has 32.7 cubic feet behind the split-folding rear seats and 73.5 cubic feet with them folded.</p>

<p>Available features include Buick’s IntelliLink infotainment system with a 7.0- or 8.0-inch touchscreen, Apple CarPlay and Android Auto compatibility, navigation, a Bose premium audio system, wireless phone charging, 4G LTE connectivity, Bluetooth connectivity, a rearview camera, full LED headlights, heated and ventilated front seats with massage function, front and rear park assist, keyless entry/start, and alloy wheels up to 19 inches in diameter.</p>

<p><strong>Safety</strong></p>

<p>Available active safety features include automatic emergency braking, forward collision warning, lane change assist, blind-spot warning with rear cross-traffic alert, pedestrian detection, lane keeping assist with lane departure warning, and adaptive cruise control.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In a 2018 <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/regal/2018/2018-buick-regal-quick-drive-review/">Quick Drive</a> review, we noted that the Regal Sportback with the 2.0-liter turbo-four accelerates merely adequately and the transmission shifts smoothly. The larger TourX wagon drives similarly but feels its size. With its more powerful engine, the Regal GS accelerates with more authority and the engine has a pleasing sound. The nine-speed automatic shifts smoothly and the Continuous Damping Control system smoothens out the ride on uneven road surfaces.</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>The Buick Regal is built by Opel in Russelsheim, Germany.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors</strong></p>

<p><strong>What’s New</strong></p>

<p>Everything. The <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/enclave/2018/2018-buick-enclave-avenir-first-look-review/">2018 Buick Enclave is all new</a> and rides on GM’s new long-wheelbase C1XX chassis that underpins the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/traverse/2018/">Chevrolet Traverse</a>.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary</strong></p>

<p>The full-size three-row <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/enclave/2018/">2018 Buick Enclave</a> sits above the two-row midsize <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/envision/2018/">Buick Envision</a> and subcompact <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/encore/2018/">Buick Encore</a> in the automaker’s crossover lineup. The new Enclave Avenir is the brand’s flagship crossover model. <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/">Buick</a> will <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/buick-add-avenir-model-across-lineup-next-two-years/">add the Avenir trim to more models</a> over the next few years.</p>

<p><strong>Overview</strong></p>

<p>All new for 2018, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/enclave/2018/">Buick Enclave</a> is powered by a 3.6-liter V-6 mated to a new nine-speed automatic transmission. The engine is preliminarily rated at 302 hp and 260 lb-ft of torque. Front-drive is standard, while Intelligent AWD is available. The all-wheel-drive system features an active twin-clutch rear differential to distribute power side-to-side. An optional continuously variable real-time damping suspension with Sport mode is available.</p>

<p>Standard features include LED taillights, keyless entry and pushbutton start, tri-zone climate control, the ability to turn the car into a 4G LTE Wi-Fi hot spot, a 10-speaker Bose audio system, as well as Apple CarPlay and Android Auto connectivity.
