The loaded Enclave Avenir model features new bifunctional LED headlights, 20-inch alloy wheels, extended leather and wood finishes, and more interior color combinations.</p>

<p><strong>Safety</strong></p>

<p>Although the new 2018 Buick Enclave hasn’t been crash tested, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/traverse/2017/">2017 Chevrolet Traverse</a> built on the same chassis earned a five-star overall safety rating from the NHTSA (out of a possible five stars) and earned a Good rating from the IIHS for all the crash tests. We expect the new Enclave to earn similar results.</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>The Evonik Acrylite exterior headlights are composed of more than 100 LEDs.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>Changes to the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/encore/2018/">2018 Buick Encore</a> include an available ionizing interior air cleaner, HD radio, a standard capless fuel filler, and a new exterior color – Coppertino Metallic.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>The Encore is the smallest crossover in <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/">Buick</a>’s lineup, positioned before the large and more expensive Envision and Enclave and is the automaker’s most affordable vehicle.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/encore/2018/">Buick Encore</a> utilizes a 1.4-liter turbocharged I-4 with two different power outputs. The standard multi-port injection version makes 138 hp and 148 lb-ft of torque and has an EPA-rating of 25/33 mpg city/highway with front-wheel drive and 24/30 mpg with all-wheel drive (AWD). The optional direct-port injection version churns out 153 hp and 177 lb-ft of torque and delivers 27/33 mpg with front-wheel drive and 26/31 mpg with AWD. A six-speed automatic is the only available transmission. In <em>Motor Trend</em> testing, a 2017 Buick Encore Sport Touring with front-wheel drive hit 60 mph in 8.5 seconds and stopped from 60 mph in a respectable 119 feet.</p>

<p>Standard equipment includes an 8.0-inch touchscreen with Apple CarPlay/Android Auto, a 4.3-inch driver’s display, 2 USB ports, Quiet Tuning with active noise cancellation, OnStar with a 4G LTE Wi-Fi hotspot, a six-way power driver’s seat, a leather-wrapped steering wheel, LED daytime running lights, and 18-inch wheels. Available features include dual-zone automatic air conditioning, a seven-speaker Bose audio system, heated leather-appointed front seats, a heated steering wheel, LED headlights, Buick’s IntelliLink infotainment system with navigation, and a power moonroof.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>The 2017 Buick Encore performed well in IIHS crash test evaluations by scoring the highest rating of Good in all five crash tests. The lowest rating of Basic was given for the front crash prevention evaluation due to the crossover’s ability to warn the driver of a possible collision, but the Encore does not have tech that will automatically brake for the driver. The NHTSA issued the 2017 Encore the highest five-star rating for the crossover’s overall score. A rearview camera is standard and available driver assist safety features include rear cross-traffic alert, blind-spot warning, front and rear parking sensors, forward collision alert, and lane departure warning.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/encore/2017/2017-buick-encore-first-drive/">First Drive review</a> of the refreshed 2017 Buick Encore, we liked the power increase from the standard engine and said, “The Encore no longer saunters off the line from a stop but instead eagerly zips forward to plug a gap in traffic like a good city car ought to.” Ride and body control are good and steering is nice, but at high rpms, things start to vibrate in the cabin.</p>

<p>The interior has been improved, is quiet, and offers a good infotainment system: “The new Buick Intellilink infotainment system (which is identical to <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/gmc/">GMC</a>’s Intellilink and <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/">Chevy</a>’s MyLink) is among the most intuitive in the industry, and it really allowed Buick’s designer’s to reduce clutter in the cabin by eliminating all of the old infotainment system’s buttons.”</p>

<p>“Not many in the segment save for maybe the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/mazda/cx-3/2018/">Mazda CX-3</a> can rival the Encore’s balance of luxury and performance,” we said near the end of our review. “With value like that, it’s easy to envision the Encore continuing to lead Buick’s sales charts.”</p>

<p>In our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/encore/2017/2017-buick-encore-sport-touring-first-test-review-premium-non-premium/">First Test review</a> of the 2017 Buick Encore Sport Touring, we were impressed with the standard features of the affordable crossover but not on “some not-so-premium qualities that include partially powered front seats (manual recline), lack of a front passenger armrest (driver gets one), an intrusive and annoying automatic start/stop that can’t be turned off, a rough-shifting transmission, and moaning engine. Not to mention the tiny rear seat that practically makes it a four-seater with adults as passengers.”</p>

<p>We enjoyed the ride and the quiet interior the crossover provided but not the lack of fun driving dynamics. The Encore received good crash safety scores, but we wish it had automatic emergency braking. At the end of our review we liked the Encore but felt the Buick was not a true premium vehicle but instead a tweener and said: “The Encore’s fast and intuitive IntelliLink infotainment system, two USB ports, very quiet interior, good fuel economy, comfortable ride quality, nice outward visibility, urban-friendly dimensions, OnStar, and affordable price tag results in a very appealing package for the A-to-B driver that prefers a high-riding cute-ute with premium qualities. So if the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/mercedes-benz/">Mercedes-Benz</a> is too much and the HR-V’s luxury just doesn’t cut it, go for the Buick tweener.”</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>The Encore shares the same platform as the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/trax/2018/">Chevrolet Trax</a>, Spark, Sonic, and Europe’s Opel Mokka.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The LaCrosse now comes standard with a more fuel efficient eAssist light electrification hybrid powertrain, a nine-speed automatic now backs the available V-6, all-wheel drive (AWD) has been expanded to the Essence model, and three new exterior colors are now available: Satin Steel Metallic, Dark Slate Metallic, and Red Quartz Tintcoat.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>The LaCrosse is <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/">Buick</a>’s flagship and is now the only sedan in the automaker’s lineup, positioned above the Regal Sportback hatchback and Regal TourX wagon. The LaCrosse has a lower starting price than the Envision crossover.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p>The 2018 Buick Lacrosse’s powertrain consists of a 2.5-liter I-4 engine paired to a small electric motor and backed by a six-speed automatic transmission with front-wheel drive. The combined power output is 194 hp and 187 lb-ft of torque, the sedan delivers an EPA-rated 25/35 mpg city/highway. The optional 3.6-liter V-6 produces 310 hp and 268 lb-ft and delivers 21/30 mpg with front-wheel drive and 20/29 with AWD and is only paired to the nine-speed automatic. In <em>Motor Trend</em> testing, The V-6 powered 2017 LaCrosse hit 60 mph in 6.3 seconds with front-wheel drive and in 6.2 seconds with all-wheel drive (those LaCrosses used an eight- and not nine-speed automatic).</p>

<p>The 2018 LaCrosse comes standard with LED interior lighting, OnStar with a 4G LTE WiFi-hotspot, Quiet Tuning with active noise cancellation, remote vehicle start, 8-way power front seats with leatherette trim, a leather-wrapped steering wheel, HID headlights, active grille shutters for improved fuel efficiency, 18-inch wheels, dual zone climate control, and an 8.0-inch touchscreen with Buick’s IntelliLink infotainment system with Apple Carplay/Android Auto. Available features include a Continuous Damping Control system, perforated leather-appointed seats, massaging front seats, heated steering wheel, Bose Centerpoint Surround Sound system with HD radio, a head-up display, wireless charging, articulating HID lights, panoramic moonroof, power rear sunshade, and 20-inch wheels.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/lacrosse/2018/">2018 Buick LaCrosse</a> received the highest five-star rating from the NHTSA for the sedan’s overall rating. The 2017 LaCrosse is considered a 2017 Top Safety Pick (the second highest honor) for receiving the highest score of Good in all crash evaluations and the highest rating of Superior for front crash prevention (the “+” designation was missed due to a Poor score in headlights). The Superior rating was issued because the sedan properly warned the driver of a possible collision, avoided a 12 mph collision, and reduced the speed of a 25 mph collision by 24 mph thanks to the front automatic braking feature found in the Driver Confidence Package 2. That package also includes adaptive cruise control, pedestrian detection and automatic park assist. The Driver Confidence Package 1 includes rear-cross traffic alert and blind spot warning with lane change warning. Forward collision warning and a following distance indicator are additional driver assist features. A rearview camera, safety seat alert, and rear parking sensors are standard.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>One of the biggest problems for the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/lacrosse/2018/">Buick LaCrosse</a> is the interior. In our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/lacrosse/2017/2017-buick-lacrosse-first-test-review/">First Test review</a>, we said, “It looks very nice, until you get up close. Numerous editors complained about cheap materials on the dashboard and center console. It also took a lot of heat for fake wood that wouldn’t fool a toddler and fake stitching on the dash top that isn’t even carried around the corners, much less actually joining anything. The rubberlike buttons were picked on, too.”</p>

<p>The large rear seat lacked some head room: “The rear seat, although praised for its leg, hip, and shoulder room, also lost a noticeable inch of headroom.” However, the new chassis provided good and sporty handling for a big sedan, much better than the last, and the updated V-6 powertrain improved performance stats across the board, hitting 60 mpg in a respectable 6.2 seconds. We also enjoyed the good fuel economy for a big sedan and the long list of standard features.</p>

<p>“The new Buick LaCrosse is fundamentally a good car and a strong update from the previous model. It’s a letdown, unfortunately, due to a failure to sweat the small details, and that’s a pity because it’s so close to being a home run. It’s a good car, but we’ve come to expect better from Buick.”</p>

<p>The LaCrosse provides a very comfortable ride, even with the optional 20-inch wheels. “The ride is comfortable, but it’s nearly as good and almost as quiet with the 20-inch wheels that only 20 or so percent of buyers will choose. Those 20s not only make the car more attractive but also improve steering feel and add an upgraded suspension with continuous damping control on front-drive cars,” we said in our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/lacrosse/2017/2017-buick-lacrosse-first-drive-review-playing-strengths/">First Drive review</a>. We enjoyed the large and comfortable rear seats and the wider opening rear doors. We ended our review by saying, “Not everyone wants to drive (or can afford) a <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/lexus/es/2018/">Lexus ES</a>. When you want something semi-premium and spacious, consider the new LaCrosse.”</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>In addition to the QuietTuning technology, Buick took many steps to quiet the LaCrosse including standard active noise cancellation, acoustic wheel well liners, acoustic-laminated windows, triple-sealed doors, improved body noise sealing, and windshield wiper set below the hood line for reduced noise.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/cascada/2018/">2018 Buick Cascada</a> is now available in three new colors, Rioja Red Metallic, Dark Moon Blue Metallic, and Carrageen Metallic. The Dark Effects package for the Sport Touring trim is now available with the Ebony Twilight Metallic and Summit White exterior colors, in addition to Sport Red. Two new roof colors include Malbec and Sweet Mocha.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/cascada/2018/">Buick Cascada</a> is a front-drive, four-seat convertible and <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/">Buick</a>’s first drop top since the Reatta, which was produced from 1988 to 1991.</p>

<p><strong>Overview</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 Buick Cascada is powered by a 1.6-liter turbo-four with 200 hp and 207 lb-ft of torque that comes paired exclusively to a six-speed automatic transmission. Torque rises to 221 lb-ft when the engine goes into overboost for a short period of time. EPA fuel economy ratings are 21/29 mpg city/highway. With the roof up, there’s 13.4 cubic feet of trunk space but that shrinks to 9.8 cubic feet with the roof down.</p>

<p>Standard features include 20-inch alloy wheels, rear parking sensors, leather upholstery, HID headlights, 10-way power adjustable front seats, dual-zone climate control, a seven-speaker audio system, Bluetooth connectivity, Buick’s IntelliLink infotainment system with a 7.0-inch touchscreen, navigation, a heated steering wheel, 4G LTE connectivity, and a rearview camera. Options include front parking sensors, fog lights, alloy sport pedals, and the Dark Effects package, which includes red contrast stitching in the interior, Piano Black trim, gloss black side mirror covers, and body-colored fog light accents and rear accent moldings.</p>

<p><strong>Safety</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 Buick Cascada received a five-star overall rating from the NHTSA (out of a possible five stars). Forward collision warning, lane departure warning, and automatic headlight control are available as part of the Driver Confidence package.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/cascada/2016/2016-buick-cascada-convertible-first-drive-review/">2016 First Drive</a>, we said that the Cascada is a cruiser and is best driven as such. The six-speed automatic is slow to respond and its fuel economy isn’t very good because of its curb weight of right around two tons. The interior is quiet quiet even with the top down and even with the 20-inch alloy wheels, the Cascada rides reasonably well. In a straight line, the Cascada isn’t quick even with 200 hp and 207 to 221 lb-ft of torque on tap due to its curb weight.</p>

<p>As we noted in a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/cascada/2016/2016-buick-cascada-first-test-review/">2016 First Test</a>, some interior materials look cheap and don’t belong in a car that’s aimed at premium-branded cars.</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>The Buick Cascada is manufactured in Poland.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors</strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/envision/2018/">Buick Envision</a> enters the new model year without any significant changes.</p>

<p>The Envision is positioned right in the middle of <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/">Buick</a>’s crossover lineup, above the entry-level Encore but below the larger and more expensive Enclave.</p>

<p><strong>2018 Envision 1SV</strong>: The base Envision comes standard with an 8.0-inch center touchscreen with Buick Infotainment System that features Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, a 4.2-inch  driver’s display, dual-zone climate control, QuietTuning with active noise cancellation, OnStar 4G LTE with a built-in Wi-Fi hotspot, two USB ports, eight-way powered and heated cloth and leatherette front seats, rear one-touch flat-folding seats, a hands-free power liftgate, express up and down windows (all), rearview camera, rear parking sensors, 18-inch aluminum wheels, and automatic headlights.</p>

<p><strong>2018 Envision Preferred</strong>: Unlike the base model that does not offer any additional options or packages and is only available in Summit White, the Preferred trim offers the same standard features as the base model and five additional packages, many optional features, and a selection of exterior colors to choose from.</p>

<p><strong>2018 Envision Essence</strong>: The Essence trim is the next step up and adds leather-appointed seating, heated front and rear seats, a heated steering wheel, tri-zone automatic climate control, rear cross-traffic alert, lane change assist with blind-spot monitoring, 18-inch polished aluminum wheels, and chrome roof rails.</p>

<p><strong>2018 Envision Premium</strong>: The Premium trim kicks up the power and luxury with the upgraded 2.0-liter turbocharged engine, all-wheel drive, 19-inch Manoogian Silver wheels, HiPer Strut front suspension, an 8.0-inch driver’s display screen, a seven-speaker Bose audio system, lane keep assist with lane departure warning, forward collision alert, front and rear parking sensors, Safety Seat Alert, dual exhaust with bright tips, and automatic windshield wipers.</p>

<p><strong>2018 Envision Premium II</strong>: The range-topping trim comes standard with a head-up display, a navigation system, heated and cooled front seats, Automatic Parking Assist (self-parking system), and articulating HID headlights.</p>

<p>For additional safety opt for the Driver Confidence package that consists of forward automatic emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and a surround vision camera system.</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/encore/2018/">2018 Buick Encore</a> comes standard with a 2.5-liter I-4 that produces 197 hp and 192 lb-ft of torque and delivers an EPA-rated 22/29 mpg city/highway with front-wheel drive and 21/27 mpg with all-wheel drive. The available 252-hp, 260 lb-ft 2.0-liter turbocharged I-4 (standard in the Premium model) is only available with all-wheel drive and comes with a rating of 20/26 mpg. A six-speed automatic backs both engines. In <em>Motor Trend</em> testing, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/envision/2017/">2017 Buick Envision</a> T AWD (turbo) hit 60 mph in 7.1 seconds and stopped from 60 mph in 120 feet, both respectable numbers for the segment.</p>

<p>The 2017 Buick Envision received top honors from both the NHTSA and IIHS. The Envision received the highest possible overall rating of five stars from the NHTSA and is considered a 2017 Top Safety Pick+ for receiving the highest score of Good in all five crash tests and the second highest score of Advanced for the front crash prevention test. The Advanced score was earned because the crossover properly warned the driver of a possible collision, avoided a 12 mph collision and reduced the speed of a 25 mph collision by 9 mph thanks to the front automatic braking feature found in the Driver Confidence package. That package also includes adaptive cruise control with full-range speed and a surround vision camera system. The Top Safety Pick+ rating was also issued because the Envision received the second highest score of Acceptable for the headlights evaluation. Other available driver assist safety features include forward collision alert, following distance indicator, lane keep assist with lane departure warning, rear-cross traffic alert, blind-spot monitoring, and lane change alert. A rearview camera is standard and the Safety Seat Alert is standard on the Premium trims.</p>

<p>The 2018 Buick Envision offers a healthy 26.9 cubic feet of cargo space behind the second-row and a maximum of 57.3 cubic feet with the seats down. Not bad, but the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/acura/rdx/2018/">Acura RDX</a> offers a similar 26.1 cubic feet with the seats up and a whopping 61.3 cubic feet with the seats down. Legroom for the Envision totals 40.9 inches for the front seats and 37.5 inches for rear passengers.</p>

<p>All Envision models come equipped an 8.0-inch touchscreen with Buick Infotainment System (Preferred II trim comes with navigation), Bluetooth phone and audio streaming, Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, and two USB ports for smartphone connectivity and charging. SiriusXM satellite radio, OnStar Guidance, OnStar 4G LTE, and OnStar Basic are additional standard tech features. The standard configurable driver’s display screen is 4.2 inches but the available one is a sizable 8.0 inches. The seven-speaker Bose sound system and a head-up display are optional, as is the Automatic Park Assist self-parking system. The three standard 12-volt outlets and the available 110-volt power outlet (and the two USB ports) will make sure all your electronic devices are charged up.</p>

<p>In our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/envision/2017/2017-buick-envision-first-drive-review/">First Drive review</a> of the Buick Envision, we found the power from the 2.5-liter to be adequate but the engine works hard to move the crossover, and Buick did not do a good job of noise, vibration, and harshness (NVH) control. The 2.0-liter turbo-four provides much better acceleration and with less NVH. The standard six-speed automatic is good and “Buick deserves credit for how smartly tuned the six-speed automatic is; it shifts quickly, is willing to downshift, and doesn’t hunt gears.”</p>

<p>The driving experience is decent at best, the suspension is soft but transfers too much hardness over rough roads and at highway speeds. Wind and tire noise is obvious; this crossover is not quiet. The interior is luxurious with a good infotainment system and huge backseat, but, “look past the wrapper, though, and the Buick is pretty disappointing. Most of the materials below the armrests are grainy economy-grade plastics, the kind that makes the cringe-inducing scratching sounds as you run your fingernails along it. The same hard plastic frustratingly even covers the back of the front seats instead of the usual practice of wrapping the entire seat in fabric. Above your beltline, the materials aren’t up to snuff, either. The wood trim, though it looks stellar, is lacquered to the point that it feels like plastic.”</p>

<p>At the end of our review, we said, “…In a day and age where luxury crossover buyers have more choice than ever before, the Buick’s bourgeois pretensions won’t be enough to stop more informed buyers from walking down the street and driving off with a more complete package that offers up a much more luxurious experience for their buck.”</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The refreshed <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/xts/2018/">2018 Cadillac XTS</a> gets a revised front fascia, updated suspension tuning, atwo-tone upholstery option that’s exclusive to the Platinum trim, and a new version of <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/">Cadillac</a>’s CUE infotainment system. With the 2018 XTS’ revised front and rear styling, the updated car is actually 1.1 inches shorter than the pre-facelift model.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/xts/2018/">Cadillac XTS</a> is a full-size luxury sedan that slots below the flagship CT6 and is available in front- or all-wheel drive configurations. In addition to the standard XTS, there’s a more performance-oriented version called the XTS VSport that’s offered and it comes standard with all-wheel drive.</p>

<p><strong>Overview</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 Cadillac XTS comes with two engine options including a base 3.6-liter V-6 rated at 304 hp and 264 lb-ft of torque or a twin-turbocharged 3.6-liter V-6 with 410 hp and 369 lb-ft. Both engines are paired exclusively to a six-speed automatic transmission. EPA fuel economy ratings are 19/28 mpg city/highway for front-drive models and 17/26 mpg with all-wheel drive. The more powerful XTS VSport is the least efficient model rated at 16/23 mpg. Trunk space is a generous 18 cubic feet and can be expanded via the standard 60/40 split-folding rear seats.</p>

<p>Standard features include a rearview camera, keyless entry/start, remote start, Cadillac’s CUE infotainment system with an 8.0-inch touchscreen, Apple CarPlay and Android Auto integration, Bluetooth connectivity, four USB ports, a 5.7-inch multi-information display an eight-speaker Bose premium audio system, dual-zone climate control, leather upholstery, LED headlights, 19-inch alloy wheels, and wireless phone charging. Options and features available on higher trims include heated and ventilated front seats with massage function, heated outboard rear seats, a 360-degree camera system, navigation, a 14-speaker Bose premium audio system, a heated steering wheel, a head-up display, tri-zone climate control, a 12.3-inch multi-information display, a panoramic sunroof, 20-inch alloy wheels, and automatic parking assist.</p>

<p><strong>Safety</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 XTS received a five-star overall safety rating from the NHTSA (out of a possible five stars). The IIHS has yet to test the 2018 XTS but the 2017 model received a Good score in the three crashworthiness tests for which it was tested (Good is the highest possible score). In the front crash prevention test, the Cadillac XTS received a Superior rating after it avoided a 12-mph collision and reduced the speed in a 25-mph impact by 12 mph (Superior is the highest rating for the front crash prevention test).</p>

<p>Available as part of the Driver Awareness package are active safety features such as automatic emergency braking, forward collision warning, blind-spot warning, lane change alert, and following distance indicator. The Driver Assist package further adds more features such as rear automatic emergency braking and adaptive cruise control.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/xts/2013/2013-cadillac-xts-4-platinum-first-test/">2013 First Test</a>, we said that the standard Brembo front brakes on the XTS give it excellent stopping performance; however, the base 3.6-liter V-6 could use more mid-range torque to help move the heavy car around. The six-speed automatic doesn’t always want to downshift when you ask for it, but for its size, the XTS handles respectably (though the steering could provide more feedback). Ride comfort is excellent thanks to the available Magnetic Ride Control system. The XTS’ interior is well-made with high-quality materials throughout the cabin. Although the front seats are somewhat flat, they’re comfortable for long drives and the rear seats can easily seat three across.</p>

<p>The more powerful XTS VSport offers up strong acceleration and is more responsive than the base 3.6-liter V-6. On winding roads, the XTS VSport is more responsive and handles better than the standard XTS, as we noted in a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/xts/2014/2014-cadillac-xts-vsport-first-test/">2014 First Test</a>. The improved handling, especially with the optional 20-inch alloy wheels, makes the ride stiffer and causes more tire noise.</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>The Cadillac XTS VSport’s 3.6-liter twin-turbo V-6 first appeared on the rear-drive CTS VSport.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors</strong></p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The ATS will feature <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/">Cadillac</a>’s next-generation user experience system that consists of My Driver Preferences (customizable cloud-based profiles) and predictive smartphone-like navigation. Apple Watch integration is now available and auto-heated seating is standard.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary</strong></p>

<p>The ATS is the smallest model offered by Cadillac, positioned below the CTS, XTS, and CT6 sedans. The high-performance ATS-V slots below the larger CTS-V.</p>

<p><strong>Overview</strong></p>

<p>The standard engine for the 2018 ATS is a 272-hp, 295-lb-ft of torque 2.0-liter turbo-four, with an available 335-hp, 285-lb-ft of torque 3.6-liter V-6. The 2.0-liter turbo-four delivers an EPA-rated 22/31 mpg city/highway when paired to the eight-speed automatic and rear-drive (22/30 with all-wheel drive) and 20/29 mpg with the six-speed manual. The naturally aspirated V-6 is rated at 20/30 mpg with rear drive and 19/27 mpg with all-wheel drive.  The ATS-V is powered by a 464-hp, 445-lb-ft 3.6-liter twin-turbo V-6 and is rated at 17/25 mpg with the eight-speed and 16/23 mpg with the six-speed manual.</p>

<p>For 2018, the base ATS sedan comes standard with Brembo front brakes, a Bose Premium Surround Sound audio system, OnStar Guidance and Basic, an 8.0-inch touchscreen with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, three USB ports, six-way power adjustable front seats, and 17-inch alloy wheels. The Premium Performance model adds a full-color and reconfigurable head-up display, performance suspension with Magnetic Ride Control, a mechanical limited-slip differential, performance summer tires, power tilt and telescoping steering wheel, HID headlights and LED accents, illuminated door handles, power moonroof, performance-bolstered front seats, magnesium paddle shifters, alloy sport pedals and 18-inch bright forged alloy wheels. The high-performance ATS-V is equipped with active rev matching and no-lift shift features (only with the manual transmission), launch control, an electronic limited-slip differential, Michelin Pilot Super Sport summer tires, and the available carbon-fiber hood, six-piston Brembo brakes, Recaro performance seats, Performance Data Recorder, OnStar with 4G LTE and a Wi-Fi hotspot, and a Bose premium audio system with active noise cancellation and AudioPilot sound enhancement technology.</p>

<p><strong>Safety</strong></p>

<p>The 2018 ATS received the NHTSA’s highest rating of five stars for the sedan’s overall crash performance. The IIHS has not crash tested the ATS, but 2013-2017 ATS cars received the highest front crash prevention rating of Superior for properly warning the driver of a possible accident, avoiding a 12-mph collision, and reducing the speed of a 25-mph collision by 15 mph thanks to the optional automatic braking system. Without that system, the sedan scored the lowest rating of Basic for properly warning the driver of a possible collision. The Safety and Security package on the 2018 ATS consists of the Safety Alert Seat, forward collision alert with lane departure warning, Following Distance Indicator, lane keep assist, blind-spot monitoring, lane change alert, rear cross-traffic alert, automatic high-beam headlights, rain-sensitive wipers, and rear thorax air bags. For additional driver assist features, opt for the Driver Assist package that includes full-speed-range adaptive cruise control, automatic safety belt tightening, front and rear automatic braking, and a full-color head-up display.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/ats/2017/2017-cadillac-ats-20t-first-test-review/">First Test review</a> of the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/ats/2017/">2017 Cadillac ATS</a> 2.0, we felt the Cadillac was more of a sports sedan than a luxury cruiser: “From the seriously bolstered Recaro seats to the surprisingly stiff suspension and finely tuned steering, the ATS has placed its bets in one area.”</p>

<p>However, performance numbers do not stand out from its competitors: “Although it feels like one of the best-handling cars in its class, its numbers aren’t quite at the top of the game.” The ATS’ transmission isn’t as responsive as it could be, the rear seat is very small, and  the sedan’s value depreciates quickly: “This is the car you’d buy if the driving experience is far more important than any other factor.”</p>

<p>In an <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/alfa-romeo/giulia/2017/alfa-romeo-giulia-bmw-330i-audi-a4-mercedes-benz-c300-cadillac-ats-jaguar-xe-lexus-is-200t-volvo-s60-comparison/">eight-way premium sedan comparison</a>, the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/ats/2018/">Cadillac ATS</a> 2.0T finished fifth place, we said, “The best sport sedan chassis in the class is let down by a useless back seat and barely acceptable infotainment system.”</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>A 12-month OnStar subscription is included with every new Cadillac.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors:</strong></p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/escalade/2018/">2018 Cadillac Escalade</a> gets a 10-speed automatic and, on the Platinum model, a Maple Sugar interior with Jet Black accents.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>The Escalade is <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/">Cadillac</a>’s flagship SUV, positioned above the XT5 crossover. With the exception of the high-performance CTS-V, the Escalade has the highest starting price in the automaker’s lineup and is Cadillac’s only body-on-frame vehicle.</p>

<p><strong>Overview </strong></p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/escalade/2018/">Cadillac Escalade</a> is powered by a 6.2-liter V-8 that produces 420 hp and a healthy 460 lb-ft of torque that comes paired to a new 10-speed automatic and delivers an EPA-rated 14/23 mpg city/highway with rear-wheel drive and 14/21 mpg when equipped with four-wheel drive. <strong>The extended-length variant, the ESV</strong>, offers a 14-inch longer wheelbase for additional third-row and cargo room. In <em>Motor Trend </em>testing, the 2015 Cadillac Escalade Platinum (4WD) hit 60 mph in a very quick 5.9 seconds and stopped from 60 mph in 133 feet. The Escalade’s towing capacity is between a hefty 7,900 and 8,300 pounds.</p>

<p>The Cadillac Escalade comes standard with many features including Magnetic Ride Control, heavy-duty towing package, an 8.0-inch screen with Cadillac’s CUE infotainment system, five USB ports, a 16-speaker Bose Centerpoint surround sound audio system, OnStar with 4G LTE and Wi-Fi hotspot, leather upholstery, heated and cooled 12-way power front seats, heated steering wheel, wireless charging, interior ambient lighting, 20-inch chrome wheels, LED headlights and taillights, and a hands-free liftgate. For additional flair, order the Radiant package that includes 22-inch split-spoke chrome wheels, a Galvano surround grille with silver mesh, and a polished exhaust tip. Ordering the top Platinum trim will result in some of Cadillac’s most luxurious options including premium Semi-Aniline leather seating surfaces for the first two rows and Mulan leather for the third, leather-wrapped instrument panel, console, and upper door trim, sueded-mircofiber headliner and door pillar trim, 18-way power adjustable front massaging seats, a center console cooler, 22-inch premium wheels, premium floor mats, illuminated Platinum door sills, two 7.0-inch rear entertainment screens, and power-retractable running boards.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>The 2018 Cadillac Escalade received a four-star overall rating out of a possible five stars from the NHTSA. The IIHS only tested front crash prevention and issued a score of Basic for properly warning the driver of a possible collision, the automatic braking feature was not tested. Standard safety features include OnStar with automatic crash response, front and rear parking sensors, Automatic Parking Assist (a self-parking system), a surround-view camera system, Teen Driver, and a rear seat reminder feature. For driver assist safety, make sure to get the Driver Awareness package that includes Forward Collision Alert, Lane Keep Assist with Lane Departure Warning, Lane Change Alert with Side Blind Zone Alert, Rear Cross-Traffic Alert, automatic high beams, and Low Speed Forward Automatic Braking.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>At the end of our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/escalade-esv/2015/2015-cadillac-escalade-esv-first-test/">First Test review</a> of the 2015 Cadillac Escalade ESV, we said, “Aside from fuel economy (duh), CUE is really the big Caddy’s only glaring negative. The new Escalade is quick (0-60 mph in 6.1 seconds for the big dog, and the shorty wheelbase will probably be under 6); handles great for such a massive truck (go magnetic shocks, go); comfortable, luxurious, still plenty spacious (especially in ESV guise); handsome, intimidating (especially in black); and perhaps most importantly, looks like a big pile of money on dubs. No surprises then that the 2015 Cadillac Escalade picks up exactly where the last one left off.”</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/escalade/2015/the-big-test-large-luxury-suvs/">Big Test comparison of large premium SUVs</a>, we liked the Escalade’s fast acceleration and the engine’s rumble but not the long braking distance or stiff ride. The Cadillac’s interior was the best but the infotainment system is sluggish and needs work. Regardless, the Escalade came in first place out of six contenders, we concluded, “The best looking, the best interior, the best sounding, and the quickest in our test. The Cadillac Escalade Platinum stole our hearts.”</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>The Cadillac Escalade (non-ESV) has an almost even weight distribution of 51/49 percent (front/rear).</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors</strong></p>

<p><strong>New for 2018</strong></p>

<p><a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/">Cadillac</a> adds more features for the 2018 XT5 including a rearview camera mirror (the rearview mirror has an option to switch to a digital display that shows what’s behind the vehicle, if cargo or rear-seat passengers block visibility), automatic heated steering wheel, Apple CarPlay and Android Auto compatibility, front and rear seat USB ports, and Cadillac’s latest generation of the CUE infotainment system.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary </strong></p>

<p>The midsize XT5 is currently Cadillac’s smallest crossover, positioned below the full-size Escalade. Factoring in sedans, the XT5 has a higher starting price than the ATS but starts lower than the CTS sedan.</p>

<p><strong>Overvie </strong></p>

<p>Powering the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/xt5/2018/">2018 Cadillac XT5</a> is a 310-hp, 271-lb-ft of torque 3.6-liter V-6 paired to an eight-speed automatic. The engine sends power to the front wheels (EPA-rated 19/26 mpg city/highway) or to an all-wheel drive system (18/25 mpg). The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/xt5/2018/">Cadillac XT5</a> FWD hit 60 mph in quick 6.4 seconds (6.5 with AWD) and stopped from 60 mph in a somewhat lengthy 128 feet (but the AWD model stopped in a much shorter 111 feet). The crossover’s towing capacity is 3,500 pounds.</p>

<p>The 2018 Cadillac XT5 comes well equipped with 18-inch wheels, power tilt and telescoping steering wheel, power liftgate, Okapi deco wood trim, eight-way driver and six-way passenger powered seats, the CUE infotainment system with an 8.0-inch touchscreen with Apple CarPlay and Andriod Auto, an eight-speaker Bose premium audio system, dual-zone climate control, wireless charging, and OnStar with 4G LTE and Wi-Fi connectivity. The top Platinum model adds AWD as standard, a reconfigurable 8.0-inch gauge cluster, semi-aniline leather seats, leather-wrapped instrument panel and door trim, microsuede headliner, a head-up display, hands-free liftgate, rear camera mirror, tri-zone climate control, heated rear seats, a multi-camera visibility system, Unique Platinum grille, and 20-inch polished wheels.</p>

<p><strong>Safety </strong></p>

<p>The Cadillac XT5 is considered a 2017 Top Safety Pick from the IIHS for receiving the highest rating of Good in all five crash test evaluations and the highest rating of Superior for front crash prevention for properly warning the driver of a possible accident, avoiding a 12 mph collision, and reducing the speed of a 25 mph collision by 24 mph thanks to the optional Front Automatic Braking driver assist safety feature found in the Driver Assist package. With only the optional Low-Speed Automatic braking equipped (found in the Luxury Driver Awareness package or standard on the Premium Luxury model), the second highest score of Advanced was issued because the crossover was only able to reduce the speed of the 25 mph collision by 9 mph. In NHTSA crash testing, the 2018 XT5 AWD received the highest five-star overall rating and the FWD version received a four-star overall rating. The Driver Awareness package (available on lower trims) also consists of IntelliBeam headlights, Forward Collision Alert, a flowing distance indicator, Lane Keep Assist with Lane Departure Warning, and Front Pedestrian Detection. The Driver Assist package also includes automatic seat belt tightening, Automatic Park Assist (self-parking system), Front and Rear Automatic Braking, and adaptive cruise control with full-range speed capabilities.</p>

<p><strong>What We Think</strong></p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/xt5/2017/2017-cadillac-xt5-awd-first-test-review/">First Test review</a> of the redesigned 2017 Cadillac XT5, we liked the improved handling thanks to the lighter and improved chassis. The XT5 provides a larger and more comfortable cabin than the outgoing SRX it replaced. We were also impressed with the long list of standard features. “Not only is the all-new 2017 Cadillac XT5 a worthy replacement for Cadillac’s best-selling model, but the new SUV shouldn’t have any issue competing in showrooms against rivals from Europe and Japan.”</p>

<p>During <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/cadillac-xt5-2017-suv-of-the-year-contender/">2017 SUV of the Year testing,</a> we found the “sleepy transmission’s gears too widely spaced. The lack of accelerative chutzpah feels out of place with the sharp steering and good handling balance on winding roads,” we said. The great handling is accompanied by a great ride: “As for ride, the XT5 aced the crumbling-freeway test. Jason Cammisa described it as the best of any SUV in the test: ‘Hands down. The surface ripples were just … gone.’”</p>

<p>Judges did not like the XT5’s electronic shifter and the improved CUE infotainment system was still aggravating to use.</p>

<p><strong>Cool Fact</strong></p>

<p>In China, the XT5 comes equipped with a 2.0-liter turbocharged I-4 engine.</p>

<p><strong>Key Competitors</strong></p>

<p>The myCadillac mobile app can now integrate with Apple Watch, and two additional USB ports have been added to the rear console. A <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/smart/">smart</a>-heating steering wheel and a new Satin Steel Metallic color are also new for 2018.</p>

<p>The CTS sedan is positioned above the ATS, alongside the larger but less fun-to-drive XTS, and below the CT6 in <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/">Cadillac</a>’s sedan lineup.</p>

<p><strong><a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/cts/2018/">2018 Cadillac CTS</a> Standard</strong>: The base CTS Standard comes standard with 17-inch alloy wheels, front Brembo brakes, an 8.0-inch multimedia screen with Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, SiriusXM satellite radio, an 11-speaker Bose audio system with active noise cancellation, OnStar 4G LTE with Wi-Fi hotspot, OnStar Guidance, three USB ports, a 5.7-inch instrument cluster display, wireless phone charging, eight-way power adjustable front seats, leatherette-trimmed seats, magnesium paddle shifters, remote engine start, dual-zone climate control, interior ambient lighting, automatic headlights, and a rearview camera with rear parking sensors.</p>

<p><strong>2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/cts/2018/">Cadillac CTS</a> Luxury</strong>: Moving up to the Luxury trim adds 17-inch Ultrabright wheels, leather-trimmed seating, heated and ventilated front seats, automatic heated steering wheel, a 13-speaker Bose Centerpoint audio system, a navigation system, a panoramic sunroof, upgraded interior ambient lighting, HID headlights with LED daytime running lights, power-adjustable steering wheel, automatic high beams, a rain-sensing windshield, and the Driver Awareness package of driver assist safety features.</p>

<p><strong>2018 Cadillac CTS Premium Luxury</strong>: Building off the Luxury’s features, the Premium Luxury adds the more powerful 3.6-liter V-6, 18-inch painted alloy wheels, Magnetic Ride Control, a color head-up display, carbon fiber or wood interior accents, a surround-view camera system, a self-parking system, power rear window shade, illuminating door handles and sill plates, heated rear seats, and tri-zone climate control.</p>

<p><strong>2018 Cadillac CTS V-Sport</strong>: The V-Sport adds a more powerful 3.6-liter twin-turbo V-6 engine, a track mode, an electronic limited-slip differential, performance-tuned suspension, enhanced power steering, a higher-performance braking system, 18-inch V-Sport machined alloy wheels, Pirelli summer tires, a leather-wrapped Sport steering wheel, and steering-responsive headlights. The Luxury package (tri-zone climate control, head-up display, heated rear seats, power rear sunshade, and illuminated door handles and sill plates) and the panoramic sunroof found in the Premium Luxury trim is not included in the base V-Sport trim.</p>

<p><strong>2018 Cadillac CTS V-Sport Premium Luxury: </strong>The V-Sport Premium Luxury adds back the Luxury package and panoramic sunroof, and 20-way performance front seats, a 12.3 instrument cluster display, aluminum sport pedals, performance summer tires, a more advanced Driver Assist package that includes automatic emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and a rear camera mirror.</p>

<p><strong>2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/cts-v/2018/">Cadillac CTS-V</a>: </strong>The high-performance CTS-V model comes standard with a supercharged V-8, 19-inch forged alloy wheels, Magnetic Ride Control, a performance traction management with launch control, an electronic limited-slip differential, five track drive modes, a six-piston front and four-piston rear Brembo performance braking system with gray calipers, Michelin Pilot Super Sport summer tires, a performance steering system, 20-way performance semi-aniline leather seats with microfiber inserts, heated and ventilated front seats, a 12.3 instrument cluster display, a color head-up display, quad-outlet exhaust system, a self-parking system, a suite of driver assist safety features, and front and rearview cameras.</p>

<p>The standard 2.0-liter turbo-four engine produces 268 hp and 295 lb-ft of torque and delivers an EPA-rated 22/30 mpg city/highway with rear-wheel drive and 21/29 mpg with all-wheel drive. The 3.6-liter V-6 churns out 335 hp and 285 and is rated at 20/30 mpg with rear-wheel drive and 19/27 mpg with all-wheel drive. The CTS V-Sport’s 3.6-liter twin-turbo V-6 pumps out 420 hp and 430 lb-ft, delivers 16/24 mpg, and is only available in rear-wheel drive. The rear–drive CTS-V is powered by a 640-hp, 630 lb-ft 6.2-liter supercharged V-8 that is rated at 14/21 mpg. All powertrains are mated to an eight-speed automatic. In <em>Motor Trend</em> testing, the 2016 Cadillac CTS V-Sport hit 60 mph in 4.7 seconds and stopped from 60 mph in a short 107 feet.</p>

<p>The 2018 CTS received a five-star overall safety rating from the NHTSA for rear-wheel and all-wheel drive models (the CTS-V received a four-star overall rating). In IIHS testing, the 2018 CTS received the second-lowest rating of Marginal for the driver-side small overlap front crash test and the highest rating of Good in the other crash test evaluations. The highest rating of Superior was issued for the front crash prevention test because the CTS avoided a collision in a 12-mph test and reduced the speed of a 25-mph collision by 12 mph thanks to the automatic emergency braking system found in the Driver Assist package, which also includes full-speed adaptive cruise control, automatic rear braking, and automatic safety belt tightening. The Driver Awareness package (standard on the Luxury, Premium Luxury, and V-Sport) consists of blind-spot monitoring, lane change alert, lane keep assist, lane departure warning, forward collision warning, rear-cross traffic alert, automatic high beams, a rain-sensing windshield, and a rear seat alert system.</p>

<p>The Cadillac CTS, which can carry up to 13.7 cubic feet of cargo in its trunk, offers 42.6 inches of front seat legroom and 35.4 inches of rear seat legroom. The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/5-series/2018/">BMW 5 Series</a> beats the CTS with 18.7 cubic feet of cargo space in the trunk.</p>

<p>The base CTS Standard comes well equipped with an 8.0-inch infotainment screen with Apple CarPlay, Android Auto, SiriusXM satellite radio, an 11-speaker Bose audio system, OnStar 4G LTE with a Wi-Fi hotspot, OnStar Guidance, three USB ports, a 5.7-inch instrument cluster display, and wireless phone charging. A 13-speaker Bose Centerpoint audio system, a navigation system, and a Driver Awareness package of driver-assist safety features is standard on the Luxury trim. The Premium Luxury trim adds a color head-up display, a surround-view camera system, and a self-parking system. The Driver Assist package and the larger 12.3-inch instrument cluster display are standard on the V-Sport Premium Luxury trim.</p>

<p>Watch the 2017 Cadillac CTS-V go up against the 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/mercedes-benz/">Mercedes-Benz</a> E63 sedan in <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mtsmVu2ufVY">episode 97 of <em>Head 2 Head.</em></a></p>

<p>After one year with our <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/cadillac/cts/2014/2014-cadillac-cts-vsport-review-verdict/">long-term 2014 Cadillac CTS V-Sport</a>, we appreciated that the car didn’t require any unscheduled trips to the dealer and that our average fuel economy was slightly higher than the EPA’s figure. We concluded by saying, “A year later, the CTS V-Sport continues to be everything we wanted it to be. It’s a quiet, comfortable, and refined luxury sedan that seamlessly morphs into a powerful, precise cornering machine at the drop of a hat. It’s immensely fun to drive at all times yet never feels crude or punishing, and it’s one of the few press cars I’ll truly miss.”</p>

<p>In <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/2014-motor-trend-car-of-the-year-cadillac-cts/">2014 Motor Trend Car of the Year testing</a>, we liked the CTS’ value, its design inside and out, the economical 2.0-liter turbo-four engine option, and the superb chassis.</p>

<p>“More than just a great performer, the CTS is a refined commuter. Noise, vibration, and harshness from the powertrain and suspension are notably absent, with only the slap of the tires to remind you of the world outside.”</p>

<p>Cadillac built a sedan worthy of its German rivals, and the CTS became <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/2014-motor-trend-car-of-the-year-cadillac-cts/">our 2014 Car of the Year</a>:  “…The CTS’ intended function is to take the fight to <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/bmw/">BMW</a>, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/mercedes-benz/">Mercedes</a>-Benz, and <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/audi/">Audi</a> — and win. It had to beat them on style, on performance, on comfort, and on quality. It has,” we said. “The CTS demonstrated superior advancement in design, performance, handling, and experience over the other two. The CTS’ ride and handling compromise was unmatched, as were cabin noise and isolation. Were the Cadillac to give ground, it would only be on rear-seat space.”</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/trax/2018/">2018 Chevrolet Trax</a> gets three new exterior colors that include Storm Blue Metallic, Sandy Ridge Metallic, and Cajun Red Tintcoat. A new <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/chevrolet-red-line-editions-rev-up-chicago-auto-show/#chevrolet-trax-redline-front-three-quarters">Redline edition model</a> is now available and gets black 18-inch alloy wheels with red accent strips, black side mirrors, a black grille, black Bowtie badges, Black cloth/leatherette upholstery, and a black Trax badge with red outlines. Premier models now come standard with forward collision warning, lane departure warning, and a sunroof.</p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/trax/2018/">Chevrolet Trax</a> is a subcompact crossover that’s available in three trims and in front- or all-wheel-drive configurations. The small crossover slots below the larger Equinox.</p>

<p><strong>Trax LS: </strong>The base LS trim comes standard with a rearview camera, cloth upholstery, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/">Chevrolet</a>’s MyLink infotainment system with a 7.0-inch touchscreen, Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, 16-inch steel wheels with covers, two USB ports, and a 3.5-inch instrument cluster display.</p>

<p><strong>Trax LT: </strong>Moving up to the LT grade adds LED daytime running lights, LED taillights, projector headlights, 16-inch alloy wheels, cruise control, remote start, upgraded cloth upholstery, and a storage bin under the front passenger seat.</p>

<p><strong>Trax Premier: </strong>Range-topping Premier models add fog lights, 18-inch alloy wheels, keyless entry and start, heated front seats, leatherette upholstery, a leather-wrapped steering wheel, a sunroof, and a seven-speaker Bose audio system.</p>

<p>The 2018 Trax is powered by a 1.4-liter turbo-four with 138 hp and 148 lb-ft of torque paired to a six-speed automatic transmission. EPA fuel economy ratings are 25/33 mpg city/highway for front-drive models and 24/30 mpg with all-wheel drive.</p>

<p>The 2018 Trax received a five-star overall rating from the NHTSA (out of a possible five stars). In IIHS testing, the 2018 Trax received a Good score on all crashworthiness tests except the passenger side front small overlap test where it received an Average rating (Good is the highest rating).</p>

<p>In the IIHS’ front crash prevention test, the 2018 Trax received a Basic rating for its available forward collision warning system (Superior is the highest rating. Forward collision warning, lane departure warning, blind-spot monitoring and rear cross-traffic alert come standard on the Premier trim and part of the optional Driver Confidence package on the LT grade. Automatic emergency braking, adaptive cruise control, and pedestrian detection are not available on the 2018 Trax.</p>

<p>The 2018 Trax has 18.7 cubic feet with the standard split-folding rear seats in place. Fold them down and the crossover can hold 48.4 cubic feet of cargo.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/trax/2017/2017-chevrolet-trax-first-drive-review/">2017 First Drive</a>, we said that the availability of Android Auto and Apple CarPlay gives it a better infotainment system that’s easy to use. Ride quality is good with the 16-inch alloy wheels but the car’s handling doesn’t feel sporty and its acceleration isn’t as punchy. In city driving, the Trax easily keeps up with traffic.</p>

<p>The pre-facelift Trax placed fifth in a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/subaru/xv-crosstrek/2015/the-big-test-2015-2016-subcompact-crossovers/">2015 comparison test</a> that also included the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/honda/hr-v/2018/">Honda HR-V</a>, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/nissan/">Nissan</a> Juke, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/mazda/cx-3/2018/">Mazda CX-3</a>, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/jeep/renegade/2018/">Jeep Renegade</a> and the previous-generation <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/subaru/crosstrek/2018/">Subaru Crosstrek</a>. That 2015-model-year crossover’s 1.4-liter turbo-four suffered from plenty of turbo lag and the six-speed automatic always wanted to stay on the highest gear. On the road, we found there was excessive body roll through turns, and interior quality lagged behind the competition.</p>

<p>The 2018 Trax is closely related to the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/encore/2018/">Buick Encore</a> and the European-market Opel Mokka.</p>

<p>With the exception of a new color (Sandy Ridge Metallic) the Malibu Hybrid does not receive any significant changes for the 2018 model year.</p>

<p>The Malibu is <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/">Chevrolet</a>’s second largest and most expensive sedan, positioned above the Cruze but below the Impala. The Malibu is Chevrolet’s only other electrified sedan; the automaker also offers the Volt plug-in and Bolt EV hatchbacks.</p>

<p><strong>2018 Malibu Hybrid</strong>: The Malibu Hybrid’s single trim is well-equipped with Chevrolet’s MyLink system displayed on a 7.0-inch touchscreen with Bluetooth, SiriusXM, OnStar 4G LTE with a Wi-Fi hotspot, as well as Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. The Malibu also comes standard with an eight-way power driver’s seat, a 3.5-inch instrument panel driver’s display, a hybrid-specific instrument cluster, dual-zone automatic climate control, 17-inch aluminum wheels, automatic headlights, OnStar Guidance, OnStar Basic, and a rearview camera.</p>

<p>A six-way power passenger’s seat, leather upholstery, heated front seats, and a Bose premium audio system can be added with the Leather package. The Convenience and Technology package adds remote engine start, auto-dimming rearview mirror, an 8.0-inch touchscreen display, and wireless charging.</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/malibu/2018/">2018 Chevrolet Malibu</a>’s hybrid powertrain consists of a 122-hp, 130-lb-ft of torque 1.8-liter I-4 paired with two electric motors that have a total combined power output 182 hp and 277 lb-ft. A CVT transmission routes power to the front wheels. The EPA rates the Malibu Hybrid at 49/43 mpg city/highway with an impressive 598-mile driving range. In <em>Motor Trend</em> testing, the 2017 Malibu Hybrid hit 60 mph in 7.5 seconds and stopped from 60 mph in 121 feet.</p>

<p>The NHTSA gave the 2018 Malibu Hybrid the highest overall safety rating of five stars. In IIHS testing, the non-hybrid 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/malibu/2018/">Chevrolet Malibu</a> is considered a 2017 Top Safety Pick for receiving the highest rating of Good in five crash test evaluations and the highest rating of Superior for the front crash prevention evaluation thanks to the emergency automatic braking system found in the Driver Confidence Package II. That package is available on the non-hybrid Premier trim but not on the Malibu Hybrid, which offers a low-speed emergency automatic braking system in the Driver Confidence package. With just the Driver Confidence package, the 2018 Malibu received the second-highest rating of Advanced for avoiding a 12 mph collision and reducing a 25 mph impact by 9 mph.</p>

<p>The Malibu did not receive the 2018 Top Safety Pick designation because the sedan received the second-lowest rating of Marginal in the new passenger-side small overlap front crash test. The previously mentioned Driver Confidence package also includes front pedestrian braking, automatic high beams, front and rear parking sensors, lane change alert with blind-spot monitoring, lane keep assist, following distance indicator, forward collision alert, and rear cross-traffic alert.</p>

<p>The Malibu Hybrid offers 11.6 cubic feet of cargo space in the truck (the non-hybrid model has 15.8 cubic feet) and 42 inches of legroom for the front passengers and 38.1 inches for the rear passengers. The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/ford/fusion/2018/">Ford Fusion</a> Hybrid wins in each category with 12.0 cubic feet of cargo room in the truck and 44.3 inches of front seat legroom and 38.8 inches of rear seat legroom.</p>

<p>The 2018 Malibu Hybrid comes standard with plenty of technology including a 7.0-inch touchscreen with the Chevrolet MyLink system, Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, SiriusXM, Bluetooth, and a USB port (dual USBs are available). OnStar Guidance, OnStar 4G LTE with a Wi-Fi hotspot, and OnStar Basic are also standard. A larger 8.0-inch touchscreen with navigation and a nine-speaker Bose premium audio system are optional. Additional feature include remote engine start, a wireless smartphone charger, and a package of driver assist safety features.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/malibu-hybrid/2016/2016-chevrolet-malibu-hybrid-quick-test-review/">Quick Test review</a> of the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/malibu-hybrid/2016/">2016 Chevrolet Malibu Hybrid</a>, we liked our initial driving experience and said, “The electric motor provides plenty of low-end grunt off the line, though the 1.8-liter engine felt coarser as it climbed up the rev range compared to the gas-only turbo engine options. The steering is nicely weighted for the class and provides a linear and predictable feel, and the suspension is nicely tuned for a balance between ride comfort and handling.”</p>

<p>In <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/chevrolet-malibu-2016-motor-trend-car-of-the-year-contender/">2016 <em>Motor Trend</em> Car of the Year testing</a>, we enjoyed the luxury, ride, and comfort of the Malibu Hybrid and said, “It rides great and is way quieter than the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/audi/a6/2018/">Audi A6</a> on the road.” We were also impressed with all the standard technology: “The car can be a mobile hotspot with 4G connectivity, and it provides Apple CarPlay and Android Auto. It also has techno-safety features such as adaptive cruise control, active headlight controls, and front pedestrian alert.” We concluded by saying that “overall, the Malibu is vastly improved, and the new hybrid is one of the best in the segment.”</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/tahoe/2018/">2018 Chevrolet Tahoe</a> gets a new RST Edition model with a more powerful engine and 10-speed automatic transmission that’s available on the LT and Premier grades. LS models can now be had in Custom Edition form and all models now come standard with LED daytime running lights. Two new exterior colors, Havana Metallic and Satin Steel Metallic, have been added. A Borla exhaust system and Brembo front brakes are now available as dealer-installed options.</p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/tahoe/2018/">Chevrolet Tahoe</a> is a full-size SUV that slots above the Traverse and below the larger and mechanically related Suburban. The Tahoe can seat up to eight passengers in rear- or four-wheel drive configurations. Three trim levels are available.</p>

<p><strong>Tahoe LS:</strong> The base LS trim comes standard with 18-inch alloy wheels, tri-zone climate control, remote start, rear parking sensors, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/">Chevrolet</a>’s MyLink infotainment system with an 8.0-inch touchscreen, Apple CarPlay and Android Auto integration, Bluetooth, a six-speaker audio system, cloth upholstery, a 4.2-inch multi-information display, keyless entry, and 60/40 split-folding second- and third-row seats.</p>

<p><strong>Tahoe LT:</strong> Moving up to the LT trim gets you a programmable power liftgate, heated front seats, leather upholstery, and a nine-speaker Bose audio system.</p>

<p><strong>Tahoe Premier:</strong> The range-topping Premier trim adds fog lights, HID headlights, 20-inch alloy wheels, keyless start, front parking sensors, 12-way power front seats, ventilated front seats, power-operated folding second- and third rows, Magnetic Ride Control, navigation, a 10-speaker Bose audio system, wireless phone charging, and heated second row seats.</p>

<p>Notable options like RST Edition package adds 22-inch alloy wheels, black bowtie badges, a unique grille, body-colored door handles and headlight accents, black side mirror caps, beltline moldings and roof rails, and black name badges. The RST Performance package gets you a 6.2-liter V-8, 10-speed automatic, a 170 amp alternator, a high-capacity air cleaner, a 3.23 axle ratio, and an integrated trailer brake controller. Options such as navigation, a rear seat entertainment system, and a sunroof are available as part of a package. The LT trim is available with the Z71 Off-Road package, which gets you skid plates, all-terrain tires, a 3.42 rear axle, a two-speed transfer case, hill descent control, an off-road-tuned suspension, and black side steps.</p>

<p>The 2018 Tahoe is available with two V-8 engines, a base 5.3-liter with 355 hp and 383 lb-ft of torque and an optional 6.2-liter with 420 hp and 460 lb-ft, which is available only on the RST Edition. A six-speed automatic transmission is standard with the 5.3-liter and the 6.2-liter comes with a 10-speed automatic.</p>

<p>EPA fuel economy ratings are 16/23 mpg city/highway for the rear-drive 5.3-liter and 16/22 mpg with four-wheel drive. With the 6.2-liter the Tahoe’s fuel economy estimates drop to 14/23 mpg for rear-drive models and 14/22 mpg with four-wheel drive.</p>

<p>The 2018 Chevrolet Tahoe received a four-star overall rating from the NHTSA (out of a possible five stars). The IIHS hasn’t crash tested the 2018 Tahoe but it received a Basic rating in the front crash prevention test for having a forward collision warning system (Superior is the highest rating for the front crash prevention test).</p>

<p>Available as part of the Enhanced Driver Alert package on the LS trim are a host of active safety features including forward collision warning, low-speed automatic emergency braking, lane keeping assist, lane departure warning, a safety alert seat, and automatic high beam headlights. The Enhanced Driver Alert package is standard on the LT and Premier grades. Additional safety tech are available as part of the Luxury package on the LT trim and as standard on the Premier trim include rear cross-traffic alert, blind-spot monitoring and lane change alert. Adaptive cruise control is only available on the Premier trim and it comes bundled with an enhanced automatic emergency braking system that works at higher speeds.</p>

<p>With the third row in place, there’s 15.3 cubic feet of cargo space and it can be expanded to 51.7 cubic feet with the second row down and 94.7 cubic feet behind the front seats when the second and third rows are folded down.</p>

<p>With the optional Trailering package, the 2018 Tahoe can tow up to 8,600 pounds in rear-drive guise or 8,400 pounds with four-wheel drive. The more powerful RST Edition is limited to 8,400 pounds for rear-drive models or 8,100 pounds on four-wheel-drive-equipped variants.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/news/2015-gmc-yukon-xl-denali-chevrolet-suburban-second-drive/">2015 First Test</a>, we said that the Tahoe offers excellent visibility but the 5.3-liter V-8 is merely adequate to haul around a massive SUV. The throttle pedal is also slow, making the Tahoe feel sluggish. As for the six-speed automatic, its efficiency-minded tuning means it always wants to get to the highest gears quickly. As in the larger Suburban, the cylinder deactivation system is seamless. The Tahoe’s brake pedal is surprisingly firm and ride quality is generally good but you do feel big bumps. Not much noise enters the cabin, keeping it well insulated and making conversations easy.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/tahoe/2018/2018-chevrolet-tahoe-rst-performance-edition-first-test-review/">2018 First Test</a>, we noted that the 6.2-liter V-8 and a quick-shifting 10-speed automatic makes the Tahoe RST accelerate quicker. However, even with the optional Brembo front brakes, its stopping performance isn’t any better than other Tahoes. The Magnetic Ride Control system helps it handle better and eliminates nearly all traces of body roll.</p>

<p>The 2018 Tahoe placed third in a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/ford/expedition/2018/ford-expedition-vs-chevrolet-tahoe-vs-dodge-durango-vs-toyota-sequoia-vs-nissan-armada/">recent comparison test</a> that also included the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/dodge/durango/2018/">Dodge Durango</a>, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/ford/expedition/2018/">Ford Expedition</a>, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/nissan/armada/2018/">Nissan Armada</a>, and <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/toyota/sequoia/2018/">Toyota Sequoia</a>. Its six-speed automatic transmission is lazy and its lack of an independent rear suspension meant it also rode worse than its rivals. Off-road was where the Tahoe performed well, easily able to crawl through the rough stuff. Third row accommodations are tight in the Tahoe but its infotainment system is easy to use and has a lot of USB ports to keep mobile devices charged.</p>

<p>The 10-speed automatic transmission in the Tahoe RST was co-developed with <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/ford/">Ford</a> and is also found in the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/ford/f-150/2018/">Ford F-150</a> and Expedition.</p>

<p>Key Competitors</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/colorado/2018/">2018 Chevrolet Colorado</a> gets two new exterior colors: Kinetic Blue and Satin Steel Gray Metallic. ZR2 variants gets heated side mirrors and an Active Tow feature.</p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/colorado/2018/">Chevrolet Colorado</a> is a midsize truck that slots below the larger Silverado 1500 and is available in two cab styles, two bed lengths, five trim levels. and with RWD or 4WD.</p>

<p><strong>Colorado Base: </strong>The most basic Colorado available comes with Bluetooth, a rear-view camera, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/">Chevrolet</a>’s MyLink infotainment system with a 7.0-inch touchscreen, Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, a USB port, a six-speaker audio system, a 3.5-inch instrument cluster display, 16-inch steel wheels, and vinyl seats.</p>

<p><strong>Colorado WT: </strong>Moving up to the WT models adds rear underseat storage for extended cab models, a folding rear bench seat for the crew cab, a six-speed automatic, and carpeted flooring.</p>

<p><strong>Colorado LT: </strong>Jumping up to the LT grade gets you 17-inch alloy wheels, a larger 8.0-inch touchscreen, keyless entry, a leather-wrapped steering wheel, a two additional USB ports, a power-adjustable driver’s seat, cruise control, a 4.2-inch instrument cluster display, and cloth upholstery.</p>

<p><strong>Colorado Z71: </strong>One of two off-road-oriented models, the Z71 adds an off-road suspension setup, an automatic locking rear differential, a transfer case shield for four-wheel-drive models, automatic climate control, leather upholstery, an EZ Lift &amp; Lower tailgate, hill descent control, a power-adjustable front passenger’s seat, heated front seats, and remote start.</p>

<p><strong>Colorado ZR2: </strong>The most capable model in the Colorado lineup, the ZR2 is only available with the V-6 or diesel I-4 and comes with a more aggressive off-road suspension setup that’s raised for extra ground clearance, Multimatic DSSV dampers, all-terrain tires, integrated trailer brake control, a unique front bumper, wider front fenders, a black rear bumper, and ZR2-specific leather upholstery.</p>

<p>Optional extras include a wireless phone charger, navigation, and a seven-speaker Bose audio system. Chevrolet also offers some exterior appearance packages like the Midnight package, which adds 17-inch black-painted wheels, a spray-on bedliner, a body-colored grille, black Bowtie badges, and Goodyear all-terrain tires.</p>

<p>The 2018 Colorado comes standard with a 2.5-liter I-4 that produces 200 hp and 191 lb-ft of torque. A 3.6-liter V-6 with 308 hp and 275 lb-ft and a 2.8-liter turbodiesel I-4 with 181 hp and 269 lb-ft are optional. A six-speed manual is standard with the base 2.5-liter I-4 and a six-speed automatic is available. Diesel-powered models come exclusively with a six-speed automatic and the V-6 is paired to General Motors’ in-house-designed eight-speed automatic.</p>

<p>EPA fuel economy ratings for the base 2.5-liter I-4 are 20/26 mpg city/highway for rear-drive models regardless of transmission choice and 19/24 mpg with four-wheel drive. The more powerful V-6 engine is rated at 18/25 mpg in rear-drive guise and 17/24 mpg with four-wheel drive. Diesel-powered Colorados are the most efficient at 22/30 mpg with rear-wheel drive and 20/28 mpg when you opt for four-wheel drive. ZR2 models are the least efficient at 19/22 mpg for the diesel and 16/18 mpg with the V-6.</p>

<p>The 2018 Colorado received a four-star overall safety rating from the NHTSA (out of a possible five stars). In IIHS testing, the crew cab variant received a Good score on all crashworthiness tests except the passenger side front overlap test where it hasn’t been tested (Good is the highest possible score). Extended cab models had slightly worse scores because they only received an Average rating on the passenger side front small overlap test and the side impact test. Both body styles got a Poor score on the headlights test.</p>

<p>Both cab styles of the 2018 Colorado received a Basic rating on the front crash prevention test for having an available forward collision warning system (Superior is the highest rating on the forward collision prevention test). Lane departure warning and forward collision warning are available only on the LT trim.</p>

<p>Depending on the cab style, engine and drivetrain configuration, the 2018 Colorado can carry up to 1,574 pounds of payload and tow up to 7,700 pounds. Max payload drops to 1,100 pounds on the ZR2 and towing capacity goes down to 5,000 pounds.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/colorado/2018/2018-chevrolet-colorado-zr2-gas-diesel-first-test-review/">2018 First Test</a>, we said that the Colorado ZR2 model offers even better off-road performance thanks to its upgraded suspension, better departure angles, and all-terrain tires. However, the ZR2’s added weight does slow down straight-line acceleration. Despite the off-road kit, the Colorado ZR2 doesn’t sacrifice on-road handling and still drives as well as other variants. Once you do get off the pavement, the ZR2 models can crawl through nearly anything.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/ram/2500/2017/chevrolet-colorado-zr2-vs-ford-f-150-raptor-vs-ram-2500-power-wagon/">2017 comparison test</a> that also included the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/ram/2500/2018/">Ram 2500</a> Power Wagon and the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/ford/">Ford</a> F-15o Raptor, the Chevrolet Colorado ZR2 placed second thanks to its agility, small size, and a suspension that works well on all types of terrain. However, the V-6 engine needs revs to generate its power and the eight-speed automatic kept upshifting to the highest gear.</p>

<p>The 2018 Colorado’s optional diesel engine is shared with the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/gmc/canyon/2018/">GMC Canyon</a> and is built by VM Motori.</p>

<p>The <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/sonic/2018/">2018 Chevrolet Sonic</a> gets a new exterior called Ivy Metallic. Black bowtie badges are now part of the RS package. The Fun and Sun package now comes with 17-inch alloy wheels, and on models with the optional turbocharged engine, it also adds a sunroof.</p>

<p>The 2018 <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/sonic/2018/">Chevrolet Sonic</a> is a front-drive subcompact sedan and hatchback that slots below the compact Cruze and above the smaller Spark city car. The car is available in three trim levels.</p>

<p><strong>Sonic LS: </strong>The base Sonic LS comes with 15-inch steel wheels, Bluetooth, <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/">Chevrolet</a>’s MyLink infotainment system with a 7.0-inch touchscreen, Android Auto and Apple CarPlay integration, a four-speaker audio system, a USB port, cloth upholstery, and LED daytime running lights.</p>

<p><strong>Sonic LT: </strong>Moving up to the LT grade adds 15-inch alloy wheels, heated side mirrors, cruise control, upgraded cloth upholstery, power windows, steering wheel-mounted controls, remote start, and a six-speaker sound system.</p>

<p><strong>Sonic Premier: </strong>The range-topping Premier grade comes with leatherette upholstery, a six-way power-adjustable driver’s seat, heated front seats, 17-inch alloy wheels, a rear spoiler, keyless entry/start, a heated steering wheel, a sport exhaust with a chrome tip, and an upgraded multi-information display. Models with the manual transmission comes with the RS package, which adds a body kit, fog lights, black bowtie badges, a flat-bottom steering wheel, and a piano-black-accented instrument panel.</p>

<p>Rear parking sensors are available as part of the Driver Confidence package on the LT and Premier grades. Offered on the LT and Premiere trims, a Performance package adds a lowered suspension and a performance exhaust system that bumps the optional 1.4-liter turbo-four’s output to 148 hp and 163 lb-ft.</p>

<p>The 2018 Sonic comes standard with a 1.8-liter I-4 with 138 hp and 125 lb-ft of torque, which can be paired to a five-speed manual or six-speed automatic transmission. A 1.4-liter turbo-four rated at 138 hp and 148 lb-ft is optional and comes with a six-speed manual or six-speed automatic.</p>

<p>EPA fuel economy ratings for the Sonic equipped with the standard 1.8-liter I-4 are 26/35 mpg city/highway with the manual or 25/34 mpg with the automatic. Variants with the 1.4-liter turbo-four are EPA-rated at 28/37 mpg with the manual or 27/35 mpg with the automatic.</p>

<p>The NHTSA gave the 2018 Sonic a five-star overall safety rating (out of a possible five stars). In IIHS testing, the 2018 Sonic received a Good score for all crashworthiness tests except the passenger side front small overlap test where it hasn’t been tested yet (Good is the highest possible score).</p>

<p>On the LT and Premier grades, the Driver Confidence package adds forward collision warning and lane departure warning.</p>

<p>The 2018 Sonic sedan has 14.9 cubic feet of trunk space and can be expanded via the standard split-folding rear seats. In case you need more room, the hatch has 19 cubic feet behind the second row and 47.7 cubic feet behind the front seats when the second-row seats are folded down.</p>

<p>In a <a href="//www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/sonic/2014/2014-chevrolet-sonic-rs-sedan-first-test/">2014 First Test</a>, we said that the Sonic drives well, offering well-weighted steering with good feedback and a manual shifter that’s easy to operated. The 1.4-liter turbo-four offers enough power for the highway and passing quick-moving traffic but you need to shift frequently because the gears are tightly spaced. Ride and handling balance is good, so the car is nimble without making it rough for daily driving. Even with its small size, the sedan’s trunk is surprisingly spacious.</p>

<p>The optional 1.4-liter turbo-four in the 2018 Sonic is also used in the <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/buick/encore/2018/">Buick Encore</a> and <a href="http://www.motortrend.com/cars/chevrolet/trax/2018/">Chevrolet Trax</a>.</p>

<p><strong>Vehicle Summary</strong></p>
